boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Kushala Daora Expansion
boardgame.description:
Think you’ve learned something about slaying monsters, hunter?

To face Kushala Daora is to take on the power of a storm. You might as well try slaying a hurricane.

And that’s why we’re here! Prepare to have your mind blown.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Nergigante
boardgame.description:
Are you sure you’re prepared, hunter?

Nergigante is well-known as one of the toughest threats in the New World. Underestimate this spiked apex predator at your peril. Truly a flagship menace.

To a belligerent elder dragon that so often clashes for dominance with other elder dragons, what threat could you pose?

Be careful not to get impaled on your own pride.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Kulu-Ya-Ku
boardgame.description:
Expect the unexpected in these quests.

With its dexterous limbs, this odd monster has been spotted carrying weapons and stealing eggs right from their nests.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game
Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Wildspire Waste

boardgame.name: Love & Barbed Wire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It is the Great War. Letters flow back and forth between the soldiers in the trenches and their loved ones back home. Letters of encouragement, passion, fear, and hope. And sometimes letters of tragedy.

This is an immersive table top story game for 2 players. A game session typically takes 1 hour to play. All you need is a pack of playing cards, some paper and pens, and this short rulebook. You don’t need any historical knowledge to play— the rulebook is filled with real-life examples that will help steer you towards the kind of letters that people were writing to one another.
Discover a wartime couple trying to keep their relationship alive during the separation and horror of war. Find out whether love does actually conquer all.

boardgame.name: The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal
boardgame.description:
The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal is the latest edition of The Singaporean Dream, an interactive card game that lets you pay, steal, and sabo your way to be the perfect Singaporean.

You play a classic Singaporean Personality (different for each player) that grants you special powers.

The game goal is to collect as many dream as you can before the dream pile runs out. You can buy the Dream Cards with Cash Cards in the bank or gain them with Action Cards.

During your turn, you draw two cards and play up to 3 actions:

play an action card from your hand;
place money in bank (cards from hand to table);
buy a dream using money in bank;
use personality special power.


Keep doing this until the dreams runs out.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Golem: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden insert for Golem.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard of Murkmire Isle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Tidalbore Isles, The Dreaded Pirates Queens, a coven of sea hags have been collecting a series of enchanted artifacts that are scattered across this Feywild Domain. The Pirate Queens’ motives are unknown, but whatever they are can’t be good. The good fey of the realm have located one of these enchanted artifacts on Murkmire Isle. The artifact is said to be a part of the horde of the island’s mysterious dragon. A group of brave adventurers are needed to travel to this swampy island, shrouded in fog and obtain the artifact before the hags can get their hands on it.

A 4-Hour Teir 1 Dungeoncraft (AL) Adventure for Characters of Level 1st-4th. Part 3 of The Tidalbore Isles Series. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL3.

Includes image flies of the maps for VTT programs.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Love Letter: 2nd Edition
ラブレター 第2版
boardgame.description:
Love Letter: 2nd Edition (ラブレター 第2版) uses the same gameplay as the original Love Letter, with your goal being to get your love letter into the Princess' hands while deflecting the letters from competing suitors. From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make you a target. Rely on weaker cards for too long, however, and your letter may be tossed in the fire!

Whereas Love Letter included only 16 cards, Love Letter: 2nd Edition consists of 38 cards: the original 16 cards, 6 cards included in later editions of Love Letter, and 16 new cards. Players can either swap out original cards for new ones or simply add new cards to the deck for a wilder game.

boardgame.name: My Hero Academia: Plus Ultra! Board Game
boardgame.description: In the My Hero Academia: Plus Ultra! Board Game, you and the other players control students from U.A. High's Class 1-A. Prove that you have what it takes to be a Pro Hero by earning hero points. Defeating villains, completing events, recruiting allies, and resolving encounters all reward you with hero points. Supporting the other heroes will, of course, also reward you with hero points. The game ends after a hero earns 20 or more hero points, at which point the hero with the most hero points wins.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Ecology of Vampires
boardgame.description:
What is this?

For the first time ever for 5E, we take the classic Van Richten's Guide to Vampires and bring it to the current rule system. This supplement gives DM's various options to customize vampires to fit their campaigns, including creating older and more dangerous vampires to set against players. Also included are options concerning feeding, procreation, hibernation, and more. So sharpen your stakes, clutch your holy symbol tightly, and with conviction. For when the sun sets, the hunt begins...

This is a tool supplement for all DMs that wish to make their vampiric villains a memorable experience! Venture through the pages to unlock the mysteries of vampiric hibernation, vampire ranks and even methods of procreation! Your players will be surprised that they are not once more fighting the generic vampire of the monster manual!

Inside you will find:


Age ranking, from Fledgling to Patriach/Matriarch and the powers a vampire unlocks through age.
The stages a vampire goes till they reach blood starvation.
Vampire methods of procreation.
Rules for staking a vampire during combat.
Vampire hibernation.
Vampire Salient powers.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Undead Unicorn Invasion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This supplement gives you everything you need to unleash an apocalypse onto your world and your players, right out of the box. It will include the lead-up to the crisis, the height of the apocalypse, and the aftermath, so you can progress between them and have your players experience any facet of the calamity.

boardgame.name: Before the Guests Arrive
ゲストがくる前に
boardgame.description:
Today we're having a party! But everyone's stuff is littered around the house, so before the guests arrive, we have to straighten up this place. Grandma and Grandpa will pitch in, too, but the guests might show up at any time. Try to quickly tidy up more stuff than anyone else. Can each family member finish straightening up, and get ready to receive the guests with out any mishaps?

In Before the Guests Arrive, you do your best to tidy up a messy house for a party. To set up the game, shuffle the guests card into a small pack of cards and place it on the bottom of the deck. Lay out 10-13 cards in an interlocking series of rows and columns. On a turn, choose a row or column, and take all cards in it, adding them to your collection; if at most three cards are in the display, first refill the display, then choose a row or column.

After taking cards, you can tidy up with one member of the family. The Mom, Dad, Girl, and Boy can each tidy up two types of stuff at a time, whereas Baby, Grandma, and Grandpa can each tidy up only one type. Stuff comes in five colors, and each color has three types of stuff, e.g., baby stuff (yellow) has blocks, bears, and lollipops. Yellow stuff can be tidied only by Baby, Grandma, and Grandpa, whereas red stuff can be tidied only by the Girl or Grandma. When tidying up a type of stuff, you can tidy as much of that type of stuff (i.e., stuff with the same illustration) as you like, so it's useful to get a bunch of the same stuff and tidy it all up together.

When refilling the house, if the guest card appears, then the game ends, with everyone having one final chance to tidy up or discard a single card. Players then score points for the stars on what they've tidied, then lose points for stuff not tidied and family members not used. Whoever scores the most wins!

boardgame.name: Town 66
タウンロクロク
boardgame.description:
The residents of Town 66 can't stand it when houses with the same shape or color are lined up with each other. Try to build as many houses as you can while keeping in mind which houses in your hand can be built at the end.

In Town 66, each player has a hand of tiles, with each tile showing one of six house styles in one of six colors/patterns. (The color/pattern of a tile also shows on its reverse side.) The game has 36 tiles in total, one of each possible combination.

The first player places a tile in the upper-left corner of an imaginary 6x6 square, then on each subsequent turn a player adds a tile to a row or column in this square so long as this tile is adjacent to at least one other tile and the color/house style isn't already present in this row and column. After playing a tile, a player can choose to draw anew tile or not. If you play your final tile, you win, but if you don't draw new tiles, you might find yourself unable to play!

listing.notes: Opened, but never played. In pristine condition!

boardgame.name: Order Overload: Cafe
boardgame.description:
You and your fellow players work in a coffee shop in Order Overload: Cafe, and to keep your jobs, you need to keep a handle on all the orders coming in. Will you be able to make the right drinks?

In a round, you deal a certain number of cards face up and read them aloud so that everyone knows all the orders placed, then you deal these cards out face down to the players. On a turn, you need to name an order that's in someone else's hand. Fail to do so, and you're eliminated from play! If you collectively reveal a set number of drinks before everyone is eliminated, then you clear the level and are ready to take on tougher challenges...

What's the highest level you can clear?

listing.notes: Opened but unplayed. Cards still in shrinkwrap. In pristine condition!

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – 2021 Arena Starter Kit
boardgame.description: This set of two starter decks for Magic: The Gathering is designed to be an easy entry point into the game for two players. It includes two 60-card decks (a green-black deck and a blue-red deck) featuring cards from Adventures in the Forgotten Realms, Strixhaven: School of Mages, Kaldheim, and Zendikar Rising; two cardboard deck storage boxes; a play guide booklet; and a code that unlocks both decks on Magic Arena.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Magic: The Gathering – Spellslinger Starter Kit

boardgame.name: Final Girl: Box of Props
boardgame.description:
The Box of Props contains:

Horror Track Miniature
Deluxe Final Health Tokens
Deluxe Bloodlust token
The Desperation Die
Signature Action Cards
Promo Final Girls
Booklet of Desperate Deaths
Deluxe Time Marker
Ultimate Dice

—description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Cupcake Commotion
boardgame.description:
In Cupcake Commotion, players “bake” cupcakes by collecting frosting and cake flavors and laying them down one by one until they have a dozen. But pay attention! Opponent(s) will try and stop you using action cards like Stubborn Oven or Dropped on the Floor. The first to get to half a dozen cupcakes wins. The game is fast-paced, fun, and can easily pack along in your bag for vacations or camping trips. I created all the artwork on each card.

Cupcake Commotion is for 2-4 players and for ages from 8 to adult. It’s great for family game nights, for kids to play with each other, or to play with friends.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ギャラクシーねこのばし (Galaxy Cat Extension)
boardgame.description: In ギャラクシーねこのばし, which might be translated as Galaxy Cat Extension, you want to stretch out as many cats as possible, while not being kidnapped by UFOs. On a turn, you reveal a card, then give it to anyone at the table, whether yourself or an opponent.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

boardgame.name: Kryptik Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
The game of Kryptik can be played by 2 players in our standard format, 4 players in our more casual Krucible format, and requires nothing more than some Kryptik decks to get started. No need for dice, tokens, special mats, or boards. This immaculate card game design allows players to adopt the game more easily and gives players/store owners the option to put on draft or sealed deck events with (literally) just a booster box and some friends.

Each game of Kryptik represents your life on Kryptik Island. You are a citizen with 66 years to prove your worth to the Overseers, and these years are represented by your six 11 year cards. You must work towards victory by slinging spells and commanding your citizen allies to attack your opponent in an effort to destroy all of their 11 year cards. Hit them one more time after you destroy their final 11 year card and you win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Atlas of the Imperium: Second Survey
boardgame.description:
The Atlas of the Imperium: Second Survey is a compilation of starmaps showing the broad expanse of the Imperium and nearby sectors in Charted Space. More than 50 sectors (of 16 subsectors each) show the star systems of the empire and many star systems which border it as well.

The maps of the Atlas are intended as a navigational guide. Data on star systems shows the information necessary to allow interstellar navigation: fuel sources, starport types, bases, and allegiance. Following each sector map are the full details of each system, presented according to the Traveller 5 Core Rules but applicable to any edition.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Vade Arcanum
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Vade Arcanum provides mechanical scaffolding to support role-playing when a player decides that their PC wants to develop a new spell in game. It was initially developed and playtested during 2020, and released on my patreon in early 2021.

This edition includes a sample playthrough, a dozen new spells, a new magic-item, and two new monsters (all stats are for OSRIC.)
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Knock! (#3 - 2022)
boardgame.description:
Knock
Issue 3

boardgame.name: The Good Old Hockey Game
boardgame.description:
The Good Ol’ Hockey Game lasts 3 periods. During the game you will try to score more goals than your opponent. You have to shoot to score! But, you can only shoot if you have possession of the puck in your Offensive Zone.

Each period you will play your Player Cards trying to get closer to your opponents goal, in a series of puck battles. During a puck battle, you play cards facedown, hoping to have the highest total. The highest total wins the puck battle and moves one step towards the goal.

Use your 18 cards wisely as you balance going for the go ahead goal and saving your cards for later in the period. Perform a Line Change to save your cards.

If you run out of cards first your opponents will score as many goals as they can with their remaining cards!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Where the Sky's as Red as Honey
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
You belong to the Hive,

But the Queen is dead.

You belong to...

The Hive, once a perfectly synchronized and efficient society, was thrown into chaos with the death of its Queen. The Queen's death also meant the first recognition of personal identity for most of the Hive.

The Hive has an opportunity to make itself whatever it wishes. Will the members of the Hive recapture the structures lost with the Queen, or create something new? Will they rebuild on familiar soil, or find a new sky as red as honey? The Hive will have to reckon with its fate quickly as invaders hover at the edges of the system.

Where the Sky's as Red as Honey is a gm-less roleplaying game made for the Mock Cover Jam. The cover and title were created by Yuri R.

This game contains themes and language intended for mature audiences and thoughtful players.

Find the character sheet for free underneath the community copies in the demo section. It is identical to the character sheet that comes with purchase.
boardgame.rpg: Where the Sky's as Red as Honey

boardgame.name: d8 Monthly (Issue 1 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
d8 Monthly
Issue 1
May 2021

Creature Feature - D8 Dungeon Generator - Complete Encounter

boardgame.name: On The Hunt
boardgame.description:
In this game players take on the roles of hunters, each competing to have the most valuable collection of deer, moose and elk at the end of 5 years!

A roll of the dice determine which animals are available to hunt, then each hunter fights for control over the best hunting grounds to shoot their prized mounts.

Each round you start by increasing you priority for mule deer, moose or elk. The higher your priority, the more likely you are to be given permission to hunt that animal. Next, you all take turns placing your hunter meeples on the 6 different hunting areas. Each hunting area has different animals with different point values. If you have the most hunter meeples in a hunting area, you get to shoot first!

A final roll of the shooting dice determine whether you hit your animal or not! Each hunter meeple you have in the area is an extra shooting dice you get to roll. Will you play it safe? Or risk it for the big haul?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Halaster's Maze of Madness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 5E Adventure For Characters of Level 5 to 7

When the Mad Mage of Undermountain received visions of an apocalyptic event striking Waterdeep, he used a large runestone to build defenses against the catastrophe. But when he died during the process, his soul fractured and spread to the four corners of Faerun. Many share Halaster's visions now, and you are called upon to unravel the mysteries of the Maze Level of Undermountain and figure out what new peril awaits. Halaster's Maze of Madness includes an adventure, two new magic items, and nine new monsters.

boardgame.name: Tales from the Aerosphere
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:
Who will you be in this city amongst the clouds?

Tales from the Aerosphere is an original steampunk TTRPG that is powered by the Neon Nights system, a system that prioritizes seemingly limitless character creation freedom.

In this game you will find…

-HUNDREDS of interesting, unique, and fun Perks
-DOZENS of weapons, CogWare augmentations for your body, equipment upgrades, and items to add to your beginning character
-OVER 20 unique and dynamic NPC sheets that are simplistic and accessible to use at any table.
From medics, to assassins, to mechanics, to a literal barbarian, there are THOUSANDS of character combinations you can play in Tales from the Aerosphere.

boardgame.name: Wander the Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:
Wander the Dungeon is a dungeon crawl TTRPG inspired by video games like Dragon Quest, Deltarune, and Loop Hero for up to 3 Players and 1 Master of the Dungeon.

Using a somewhat crunchy version of titanomachyRPG's Caltrop Core, you play as Wandering Heroes traveling through a mysterious and ever-changing Dungeon. Rest at Campfires, Traverse the Dungeon, and Encounter Monsters in turn-based combat.

Heroes be warned! The Dungeon and its inhabitants are unpredictable and may send you to an early grave... but that does not mark the end of your adventure! Discover hidden secrets about the mystery of the Dungeon, including Player options beyond death!

Pick Your Class, Collect Treasure, Survive the Night, Slay or Befriend Monsters, Discover or Lose Yourself, and of course, Wander the Dungeon.

boardgame.name: Eastward
boardgame.description:
Official cooperative board game based on the critically-acclaimed video game Eastward.

This cooperative tabletop game sees 2-4 players working together to rescue villagers and defeat enemies, racing against a sinister miasma that threatens to engulf the world — complete with a foldout game board, 15 food cards, 10 item cards, and 4 unique playable character standees.

Two versions of the board game are available for preorder from iam8bit:
- Eastward Exclusive Collector’s Edition (Nintendo Switch)
- Eastward 2xLP Vinyl Soundtrack (Limited Edition Board Game)

Each version can be played independently, or together as an integrated experience.

boardgame.name: Defence Net: An invader-busting roll & write game
boardgame.description:
Your mission should you choose to accept it:

Defend Earth by setting up strategic defences and unleash massive damage on the invading fleet. Can you complete the mission in 20 turns?


Mission Overview
Player only have 20 turns to avoid space mines and destroy the Invaders fleet. You can perform only one of the following in a single turn:

a) Upgrade your defence
b) Attack the Invaders

Player attack the invaders by upgrading defence points and connecting 2 upgraded defence points with a straight line. Any Invaders within the “box” that the line crosses will take a hit. Default (not upgraded) defence points cannot be used.

A defence point is upgraded by circling it. Function of the defence point increases with the level of upgrade.

Level 1 (represented by 1 circle) - allow player to connect to another defence point
Level 2 (represented by 2 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to one other defence point
Level 3 (represented by 3 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to two other defence point

Combos Madness
3 types of defence point upgrade, 4 different types of Invader with different level of life-meter (some are tougher to destroy than other) and space mines which explode every time you crosses them. Players must plot their attack wisely to max out their mission score, those who destroy all the Invader Ships before the end of 20 turns get extra bonus points!

Print and play: One PDF, thousands of mission
The game come in a single PDF (black and white print cost friendly) which automatically generate random missions each time the file is refreshed on the Internet browser or reopened in a PDF viewer.

Each mission comes with an unique mission code. You can reprint the old mission challenge by typing the old mission code over the newly generated one.

boardgame.name: MOOGH
boardgame.description:
MOOGH is a 1 to 4-player semi cooperative programmation game where tribes of cavemen are joining forces to defeat big beasts. They will fight together in order to decide who should lead the new combined tribes. By hunting Big Beasts, they will win savage points. At the end of the game, if the cavemen win, the team with most savage points may then claim the leadership of the tribe. If the cavemen don’t meet the winning conditions before the end of the game, all the tribes will lose the game.

In MOOGH, the players will have to anticipate the actions from the other tribes and from the beasts (manage by AIs) in order to win Savage points. Each tribe will have its own actions and skills (most of the actions will be resolved by rolling dice and their success will depend of the cavemen characteristics). The game has different ways to counterbalance the randomness of the dice (rage token to reroll dice, idea cards with special actions that can be activated if you meet specific condition, etc.). There are four tribes in the base game and a lot of interesting content (a solo mode, a skirmish mode, a campaign mode, a lot of different beasts, scenario with different winning conditions, items to win, etc.).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hajiku Nemoly
boardgame.description:
Hajiku Nemoly is a roll-and-write crossword game inspired by classic Nordic-style fill-in puzzles.

Game lasts 10-12 rounds and each round has three phases: roll, write, and score.

Players collect random word units, use them to build complete words on their crossword grids (simultaneously and secretly), and then score the completed words in multiple categories. Words that are related to adjacent icons give bonus points, but repeating identical words induces a penalty. Special rewards are given for filling rows and columns. The player with most victory points wins.

Game booklet includes 12 thematic scenario grids, each with their own special rules.

All scenarios are naturally suited for solo play with minimal rules differences. Additionally, all word grids may be solved like traditional fill-in puzzles with some new twists.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Apollo 47 Technical Manual
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

In a somewhat alternate Earth in a rather different 1987 you will explore the Moon on the 47th Apollo Mission! The Moon! Where forty-six other moon missions have gone before. Forty-six. That's an awful lot of successful Moon missions.

And that's the point: Apollo 47 imagines a future where walking the surface of the Moon is a little bit boring. You engage in workaday astronaut activities using a simple improvisatory rules set to play in a quiet world of technobabble and the slow progression of science. If something exciting happens please stop play immediately and go do something else–you are in the wrong game.

This zero-prep game of improvisatory radio chatter can be played through just about any communications medium for any length of time. Five minutes to spare? Spend it recalibrating a JLDO unit that's gone out of alignment. Tighten the tamping line using the three baseline screws. The blue screen torques the focus to the left, the green screw adjusts the dust pan height. You should have a yellow-handled size 20 tamping gun and a slot puller in your work bag. Got them? Okay, so next...

One astronaut is supported by a team of voices on the radio. Work, banter, and cause gentle problems for each other.

I... I just can't explain this game any better than that.

What you get:

You are buying a twelve-hundred page book. It's 8.5x11 and over seven pounds. It's just stupid big. The books pages are distributed roughly this way:

1 page contains the game

9 pages contain advice on how to play the game

13 pages contain useful prompts for operating the game

1177 pages are reproductions of NASA manuals and papers related to the Apollo missions which can, if you need it, provide prompts to spur you on. Spoiler: I never use the prompt pages and don't really expect you to do so. They just aren't necessary for play.

This book is a tremendous folly. It's ludicrous and bloated and couldn't make me happier. If you aren't joining me in hearty guffaws at something this THIS then stick with the PDF. You'll be fine.

NOTE: The PDF is just the core game, no NASA manuals. You aren't missing anything, I promise.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: The Play Generated Map & Document Archive
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Compile
boardgame.description:
Compile is a mathematical trick-taking card game for two players, based on Cassino. The deck includes cards numbered 1-15 in 4 suits, or 60 cards in total.

In setup, 4 cards are dealt to each player and 4 face up to the centre. Players take turns putting down one card from their hand and are trying to take as many other cards from the centre as they can. Aces are worth one point each, and two lucky cards are worth three points if captured - 3 of triangles, and 10 of lozenges. Build (compile) piles of cards up over the round, but beware - the other player may be able to capture your pile!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Grandma Club
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
The Lower Puffington Ladies’ Auxiliary Society is determined to win the annual Billinghamshire County Best Village award. However, the village is not immune to trouble, and it falls upon these community-minded seniors to set things back to their right and proper place.

Grandma Club is a one page RPG that can be played with a single six-sided die. It requires one GM (Great Matriarch) and at least one OAP (Old Age Player.)

boardgame.name: The Creature Comes for Us
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
The Creature Comes for Us is a game that can be played solo or multiplayer which uses a standard deck of cards, two six-sided dice, and the players' imagination.

You play as a group of people preparing to fight against a currently unknown threat. You will learn (through drawing cards) about the creature that is coming for you, you will find resources and tactics to fight against them, and you will learn more about the unique traits and talents of the player characters. The second part of the game brings together what you've gathered to fight the looming horrors and you will find out if your characters and world can survive the onslaught.

The game can be used for a standard one-shot game with friends or for world-building and character-building purposes to slot into other systems. A finished game can leave you with a well-developed world in which to set a post-apocalyptic game for another RPG, or with ruins and a story for a future adventuring party to explore.

boardgame.name: Deep Nightly Fathoms
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Inside this zine you will find a game that will take you and your fellow players through the Kingdom of Night, a liminal space between life, dream and death, inspired—and illustrated—by the beautiful art of Gustave Doré.

Dive in to discover:

One-on-one or two-on-one play with expansions for larger groups.
Player characters who take a transformative journey over a land of sorrow.
Rules for exploring the Kingdom of Night and confront the dangers that lurk inside.
Tools to run a point-crawl exploration game, with an assortment of random tables to roll an adventure on the spot.


Let us traverse these Deep Nightly Fathoms.

boardgame.name: Perilous
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:
Perilous is a dungeon crawling RPG about braving the dark depths because the long forgotten magic of the ancients could mean the difference between life and death for the people you care about. It uses a simple 20 sided die, plain language, and tag based mechanics to make telling stories with your friends effortless.

Fighting enemies and facing dangers in Perilous is about finding clever solutions to unique problems rather than whittling away hit points. Each challenge you come up against is a collection of short descriptions that cover anything from the defenses an enemy has to the hazardous terrain you have to worry about. When you can't solve a problem right away, start building up advantages and creating openings until you can!

boardgame.name: Vivarium
boardgame.description:
1898, Siberia, the seismologist Edgar Vuntaf discovers a continent free of any human presence, sheltering a teeming life, in forms never encountered before! Unknown plants, colossal creatures... Faced with this shocking discovery, the world's scientific elite, gathered in Paris for the Universal exposition, create the Vivarium Syndicate, and decide to send explorers into this new continent

An efficient and tense card collection game, with a great artistic direction! Each turn players use dominoes to create coordinates that allow them to build their card collection. After 7 rounds, the player that has successfully completed their objectives and collected the greatest creatures wins the game.

Cards are placed on the board. Each turn, players use pairs of dominoes to create coordinates and grab the corresponding card on the board. Among this grid of cards: fantastic creatures divided according to their species and biotopes, scientific objectives but also various equipment cards to facilitate the taking of future cards. After 7 rounds, the player that has successfully completed their objectives and collected the greatest creatures wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vaalbara
boardgame.description:
Each player plays as a clan leader and has to secretly and wisely play a card from their hand, representing a member of their tribe, to try to take over some territories. Strategy and timing will be crucial for scoring! The player that scores the most points after 9 rounds wins the game.

Subcontinent of Vaalbara, Neolithic era. Your tribe sets out to explore uncharted lands in order to establish sedentary villages. Use the various talents of your tribe to optimize your development, expand your territory and enforce your hegemony!

All players have the same deck of 12 cards representing the members of their tribe. Each turn, players choose secretly one card. In the order of initiative of the revealed Characters, players will be able to activate their powers and take over one of the available Territories. Each type of Territory has its own way of scoring points (collection, pair, diversity, risk…). Deciding between playing the best powers and high initiatives at the most opportune moment will be difficult. After 9 rounds, the player with the most points wins the game and unites the tribes of the continent under their banner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sellswords of Sundara (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They are known by many names. Freelances. Soldiers of Fortune. Privateers. Ironmongers. At the end of the day, though, no matter their heraldry or honor codes, their reputation or their legends, these so-called adventurers all boil down to one thing... mercenaries. While many of these sellswords operate independently, moving from one paymaster to another as the mood and desire strikes them, others have banded together to form free companies of warriors. Often possessing unique skills, specialized training or assets not available even to the standing forces of city states, merchant houses and powerful guilds, these swords-for-hire are as varied as they are dangerous.

This supplement contains ten unique mercenary companies found throughout Sundara, detailing their histories, providing sample members to act as NPCs and giving the GM rumors to help build up their reputation and act as jumping off points should they wish to include these free companies in their games. Lastly, every free company listed in this book comes with an archetype for players who want to embody the unique skill set, training and special abilities associated with these particular sellswords. Though it should be noted that these companies are made up of various individuals with a variety of roles, so it is not necessary for one to possess this archetype in order to be (or have been) a member of one of these companies should a player simply want to use a given mercenary company as a feature for their character's background.

Lastly, membership in a given mercenary company is not required for a character to take any of the archetypes listed here. While that is the easiest story explanation for their class features and abilities, it is not the only one. An individual may be a former member of a company, for example, or have been trained by someone who was once a former member. Players and Game Masters alike are encouraged to be creative with these options in order to make them as available as possible in their games, should you wish to use them.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Sellswords of Sundara (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They are known by many names. Freelances. Soldiers of Fortune. Privateers. Ironmongers. At the end of the day, though, no matter their heraldry or honor codes, their reputation or their legends, these so-called adventurers all boil down to one thing... mercenaries. While many of these sellswords operate independently, moving from one paymaster to another as the mood and desire strikes them, others have banded together to form free companies of warriors. This supplement contains ten unique mercenary companies found throughout Sundara, detailing their histories, providing sample members to act as NPCs and giving the GM rumors to help build up their reputation and act as jumping off points should they wish to include these free companies in their games. Lastly, every free company listed in this book comes with an archetype for players who want to embody the unique skill set, training and special abilities associated with these particular sellswords. Though it should be noted that these companies are made up of various individuals with a variety of roles, so it is not necessary for one to possess this archetype in order to be (or have been) a member of one of these companies should a player simply want to use a given mercenary company as a feature for their character's background.

Lastly, membership in a given mercenary company is not required for a character to take any of the archetypes listed here. While that is the easiest story explanation for their class features and abilities, it is not the only one. An individual may be a former member of a company, for example, or have been trained by someone who was once a former member. Players and Game Masters alike are encouraged to be creative with these options in order to make them as available as possible in their games, should you wish to use them.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Cult of Apollo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Apollo, one of the most widely worshipped deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Apollo's main temples
Festivals and sacrifices held in Apollo's honor
2 New Magic Items: golden bow and oracle's sapphire
2 New Spells: fate's favored and prophecy of triumph
Paladin's Oath of the Lightbringer

boardgame.name: Bard College: College of Juggling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Though some might think of juggling as a form of casual entertainment, bards from the College of Juggling are quick to tell you of the remarkable intensity that the skill requires. A talented juggler’s simplest of movements are graceful increments in a long performance, combining martial skill with calculated but dazzling displays. Bards who master this talent can pluck one of an array of weapons from mid-air, deliver a deft strike, and then just as quickly toss it back up, all without missing a single step.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a bard character, the College of Juggling gives you options to build a bard who uses their magical talents to juggle an array of weapons in battle, using whichever one suits their needs at a moment's notice!

boardgame.name: Trouble in Southshore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The elves of Gul Nalore keep to themselves, so it was a surprise when a delegation came to the people of Southshore asking for help. Things must really be bad. But, are they bad for who you expect?

RC3: Trouble in Southshore is the third in the new Regulations Codex series from Mithgarthr Entertainment, focusing on gameplay using an Encyclopedia of Rules, but can be played with any OSR ruleset! For 4-6 characters of levels 3-5.

boardgame.name: Shadow of the Wolf
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is summer 1934, a heatwave has settled over the lake city of Neufchâtel. Newspaper reports suggest that feral creatures have wandered into the city. Reports of attacks on citizens have the population on edge. The news is worse than the papers reveal. Intelligence reports out of the city suggest that the attacks are the work of one or more preternatural creatures. As agents of Nachtrichter your team must investigate and put a stop to the attacks.

Paranormal activity is on the rise around the region. The Great War gave the world pause to consider the evils that man might visit upon man, but darker otherworldly forces threaten the peace so many died to create.

boardgame.name: Scout Base 947 Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Purpose of this Adventure book is to provide the details of a frontier Scout Base, together with three different adventures, and some plot hooks set in the environment. This type of base is the smallest maintained by the Scout Service, and is located on a backwater world in the Rim Edge subsector.

The book can provide the detailed background for a scout base as part of an on-going campaign, or can be used as a basis for a number of one-shot adventures.

This booklet contains:

Detailed plans for the Subsector, the System, and the World.
Plans for the immediate vicinity of the Base.
Plans and Artwork for the Scout Base itself, and detailed plans of the interior (both empty and cluttered).
Details of the Scout Base crew.
Adventure details and modified plans for those adventures.
Deck plans for a variant design of a 100 dt Scout/Courier.
Pre-generated characters.

boardgame.name: The Cult of Baal & the Ziggurat of Vadashar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give me that old time religion! The Cult of Baal is one of the most widespread faiths of the World of Zul. Its ziggurats dot the landscape of the megacontinent, its temple mysteries dating thousands of years ago to the mythical Era of the Four Prophets. The secrets of the cult are the secrets of the Giant Kings, and of the very gods themselves, and they are waiting to be unlocked.

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, plus cult priest descriptions, an essay about alignment, faith, and the gods of Zul, adventure hooks, and advice for incorporating the Cult of Baal into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Titan Effect Declassified Edition JumpStart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The JumpStart for Titan Effect RPG's Declassified Edition is here!!!

The world is not what it seems. Psychics and bio-augmented humans work as spies and soldiers on behalf of criminal organizations, private military companies, and secret societies in a covert war that has been raging for decades. Some are fighting for control and power, while others seek to shape the future of human evolution.

Titan Effect RPG: Declassified Edition is the latest edition of Titan Effect: The Role-Playing Game, a tactical espionage, and Sci-Fi setting Savage Worlds. Take on the role of a trained operative gifted with unique abilities. Carry out perilous missions worldwide for the international clandestine organization known as the SPEAR, and fight against dangerous creatures and organizations.

Inside this JumpStart, you will find:

An INTRODUCTION to the world of Titan Effect.
New SETTING rules.
A short ADVENTURE.
And five PRE-GENERATED characters.

boardgame.name: Beacon In the Dark (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dwarves of Karn Ungil seek to reclaim their former outpost of Ballo Dar from drow invaders. They are sending a small group of spellcasters to sneak into the heart of the outpost to reawaken its magical defenses. The dwarves of Karn Ungil ask the player characters to escort this expedition through the twisting tunnels of the Underdark. While drow attack the group, they face a greater danger — one of them has already betrayed the group from within.

Beacon in the Dark is an adventure for characters level 7–9. It is set in the Underdark and can be dropped into nearly any campaign or run as a one-shot.

In addition to the adventure, Beacon in the Dark feeatures:

3 NPC allies
6 new or modified monsters
1 new magic weapon
A GM cheat sheet to track the adventure
2 high resolution maps
7 PNG tokens for your Virtual Table Top

boardgame.name: Beacon In the Dark (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dwarves of Karn Ungil seek to reclaim their former outpost of Ballo Dar from drow invaders. They are sending a small group of spellcasters to sneak into the heart of the outpost to reawaken its magical defenses. The dwarves of Karn Ungil ask the player characters to escort this expedition through the twisting tunnels of the Underdark. While drow attack the group, they face a greater danger — one of them has already betrayed the group from within.

Beacon in the Dark is an adventure for characters level 7–9. It is set in the Underdark and can be dropped into nearly any campaign or run as a one-shot.

In addition to the adventure, Beacon in the Dark feeatures:

3 NPC allies
6 new or modified monsters
6 new hazards
1 new magic weapon
A GM cheat sheet to track the adventure
2 high resolution maps
7 PNG tokens for your virtual table top

boardgame.name: Beacon In the Dark (SW)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dwarves of Karn Ungil seek to reclaim their former outpost of Ballo Dar from drow invaders. They are sending a small group of spellcasters to sneak into the heart of the outpost to reawaken its magical defenses. The dwarves of Karn Ungil ask the player characters to escort this expedition through the twisting tunnels of the Underdark. While drow attack the group, they face a greater danger — one of them has already betrayed the group from within.

Beacon in the Dark is an adventure recommended for characters Seasoned rank or higher. It is set in the Undercaverns and can be dropped into nearly any campaign or run as a one-shot.

In addition to the adventure, Beacon in the Dark feeatures:

3 NPC allies
7 new or modified monsters
1 new magic weapon
A GM cheat sheet to track the adventure
2 high resolution maps
7 PNG tokens for your Virtual Table Top

boardgame.name: Endless Winter: Man VS Megalith Promo
boardgame.description:
An Endless Winter promo card available through the Man VS Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter

Culture card (shuffle into the Era II deck at setup)

Effect: Spend 2 Tools to gain a Tribe card and place a Megalith

boardgame.name: Fool's Ascent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

PHM #9 explores one of the only known ways to ascend the Plateau of Leng, which unfortunately for the adventurers leads right by the lair of a dreaded Leng spider, in addtion to including detailed rules for exploring in the Dreamlands, as well as a map of said realm.

boardgame.name: Endless Winter: BigFoot
boardgame.description:
An Endless Winter promo card available through The Secret Cabal 2021 Kickstarter

Animal card (shuffled into the bottom half of the deck at setup)

Effect: During the Eclipse Phase, place a Megalith

boardgame.name: Turbofans
boardgame.description:
Turbofans is a action-selection, deck-building game of operations at 15 major, U.S. Airports, over the course of 60 years, from 1960 (about the time turbofan-powered, jet aircraft first came on the scene in the U.S.) to 2020, in 12 5-year turns.

The Players will alternate playing an OPS Card from their hand, and depending on the value of that OPS card, perform one or more of actions such as purchasing Aircraft, Hangars or Hubs, creating new Flights, adding passengers to existing Flights, "shuttling" passengers and even Flights from one
airport to another, replacing ageing aircraft with newer models, improving the OPS cards in their hands, and "raiding" passengers from other player's flights.

But several actions cost money, and additionally each player will be paying maintenance every turn, prior to collecting income from their Flights.

Victory conditions are three-fold - most passengers moved during the game, most cash on hand, and most airports controlled.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Zodiac Duel
boardgame.description:
Cassandra and Sibyl are the most popular fortune tellers in the city. To resolve their eternal rivalry they decide to fight in an ultimate duel using the 12 zodiac signs and the power of the stars.
Zodiac Duel is a frenetic card game for two players divided in two phases.

Firstly, during the draft phase, you will have to form a team of 5 fighters and 3 stars. Each card represents both a fighter and a star, but you can only keep one of the two parts, so… choose wisely!
In the second phase, you will face your opponent with your chosen cards during 5 duels or less. Decide strategically how to use your fighters -each sign has a different power- and place your stars to modify each duel. First player who wins 3 duels will win the game!


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: The Jester's Colors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pirate radio broadcaster’s jokes and satire against his oppressive planetary government have made him Public Enemy Number 1, subject to the harshest of punishments. His sister, a recent refugee from the world, hires the PCs to find him and get him offworld by any means necessary. But a straightforward locate-and-extract mission must consider the planetary government’s paranoia and predilection for violence. Can the heroes pull off a near-impossible mission while avoiding becoming public enemies themselves?

The Jester’s Colors is a short science fiction adventure using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.

boardgame.name: Archetypes of the Ages: Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Come sit by the fire,
I'll tell a tale to inspire,
Of Dragons and Kings,
And the wonder of everything."

Devon looked out at his audience as he strummed his lute and warmed up his hands. Little did his audience know that the story he was about to tell them was real, and a retelling of how the events of centuries past REALLY went down, rather than the diluted stories that other bards engaged in. After all, his retelling was from one who'd been there. The dragon, Ringrodor. Admittedly, he was almost as terrifying as the other stories would have you believe, but he WAS a Brass Dragon after all, and not a gigantic Red Dragon like the stories told.

"Hear the story I tell,
And heed it well,
For it is true what I say,
The king DID the dragon lay."

Welcome to Archetypes of the Ages: Dragons, in which we look at various archetypes that you, as a player, can tie in with the greatest beasts of legend, the Dragons.

Within these 25 pages you'll find:

The College of the Transformation, for bards who tap into the power of the ancient dragons, and take on part of their shape.
The Wyrm Domain, for those humanoid clerics that worship the Dragon gods.
The Circle of the Hoard. For even druids get greedy sometimes, and to protect their hoards, they become like their draconic masters.
The Treasure Hunter ranger, for those looking to make that "one big score" and survive.
Five new Warlock Patrons: The Brass, Bronze, Copper, Gold, and Silver Dragons.
Two new spells, and seven new magic items.

boardgame.name: Deceased Hero
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A proposta de uma miniaventura é ser simples e direta. Apresentar um pequeno cenário aberto e dinâmico para aventuras curtas ou até mesmo funcionar como um material de apoio à campanhas em andamento, fornecendo algum tipo de desafio a ser incrementado à mesa.

boardgame.name: The Dragon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A wizard asks the adventurers to help him find “a dragon tail”. He then tells them that there is a dragon in nearby mountain cave...

This is a generic adventure, created for ANY type of fantasy world/RPG game/setting. The adventure is written without any rule system in mind. Most RPG rules based in this type of world should be possible to be used.

Change what you need, fill in values according to your rule system used, flesh out the NPC:s - and you're done!

boardgame.name: Tangled Vines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Goblinoid creatures lay siege week after week on the quaint town of Penshaw, leaving scant supplies in their wake and a dwindling population in desperate need of aid. But with their bodies clearly twisted and corrupted by dark magic and seeping with vicious poisons, something is clearly afoot. Will you be able to unknot these tangled vines and stop the attacks before it's too late?

Tangled Vines is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 6th to 10th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 7.

This adventure contains 4 new monsters, 2 custom hand-drawn battlemaps, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Never Swallow the Worm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The posse begins the adventure riding hard on a dusty trail with the aim of putting down a gang of roughnecks dead set on conjuring up some elder-deviltry. But best laid plans often go off the rails, and the real deviltry is taking a ride towards the town of Adobes, with a thirst for hooch, and a curse that just might spell the beginning of the end.

Never Swallows the Worm is a 1st level adventure for 4-6 characters written by David Baity.

boardgame.name: Mare Nostrum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The campaign world of Pax Lexque expands under the sea! Five underwater realms are detailed in this volume, with their history, geography, politics and religion. Also included are ten new spells and four new classes: Aquatic Elf, Chapod, Deep Hunter, and Merfolk.

An adventure for this setting is included in the latter part of this book. In Mother of Pearls, the king of the aquatic elves, King Ascal, has been attacked by a race of fish men known as the ichtharians. The party must find the king's crown and deal appropriately with the thieves.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Wave Lurker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What’s that in the damn water? That fin! It’s coming toward us!”

Like so many beasts of the Epochian new era, the people of this age call the terrifying new creatures by some physical feature or behaviour the mutie beast displays. These are straightforward, no bullshit descriptions, something that the various humanoid strains can relate to other people with few words, which is often important when a watcher on a wall or barge deck must make their cry of alarm. With the shriek of “Wave Lurker!” everybody aboard a crude scrap-built cargo ship or junk walled village knows what is coming for them. Once the alarm is given, people can either grab the right weapon, dash to their battle stations, flee to a secure area, or pray to their wasteland god for admittance to the afterlife.

Introducing the ever hungry, fast moving, reptilian wave lurker. These aquatic predators patrol the seas, lakes and swamps of the Mutant Epoch era, appear in various sizes, and like a sea lion, can drag themselves up onto the deck of a barge or shore to go after their prey. They can be encountered both in their typical form, or as mutant freaks to inflict even more mayhem and terror on hard pressed humanity.

boardgame.name: A Quick Guide to Random Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A quick guide to help you to create and add dungeons to your rpg game. This supplement is friendly to any kind of setting, filled with concepts and generators to provide quick and simple steps to facilitate adjustments and improvisation.

boardgame.name: A Quick Guide to Random NPCs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A quick guide to help you to create and add unique NPCs to your rpg game. This supplement is friendly to any kind of setting, filled with concepts and generators to provide quick and simple steps to facilitate adjustments and improvisation.

boardgame.name: A Quick Guide to Random Wilderness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A quick guide to help you to create and add wildernesses to your rpg game. This supplement is friendly to any kind of setting, filled with concepts and generators to provide quick and simple steps to facilitate adjustments and improvisation.

boardgame.name: Assault on Doomrock: Ultimate Edition – Battleground Mat
boardgame.description: 55 x 40 cm neoprene battle mat.

boardgame.name: Assault on Doomrock: Ultimate Edition – Poker Chips
boardgame.description:
59 Poker Chips for Heroes and Enemies.

Replace all Hero and Enemy tokens with 40mm poker chips. Improve the feel of the battles by stacking them with a satisfying clank.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Assault on Doomrock: Ultimate Edition – Roguelike Expansion
boardgame.description:
This new Roguelike expansion allows Heroes to complete achievements in order to level up the content of the game in current and future playthroughs.

Objectives are drawn at the start of a session, which can be completed to gain the points depicted in the upper corner of the card. Is it worth taking a detour on your path to Doomrock to accomplish one of these objectives? Sure! Nothing could possibly go wrong, could it? Once earned, these points can be used to level up the game semi-permanently. This is comparable to a legacy mechanic, but completely reversible: leveled up cards can be removed at any time.

When spending an achievement point, Heroes choose which of the 3 types of decks will be leveled up and draw 3 cards from the buffed decks of the Roguelike Expansion. One of the 3 drawn cards is chosen and will replace the card with the same name already in the deck.

The new cards are more powerful versions of their originals, bringing minor advantages like improved stats or reduced attribute requirements.

When leveling up the Ability Deck, cards will often have more powerful effects or easier/improved dice results. As you complete more objectives, more leveled up cards will be present in the game decks. These buffed cards will show up in the game more often, tempting you to pick them up from SHOPS and during Level Ups.

This expansion will add some additional decision making and richness, and make the gamemarginallyeasier each playthrough.

The Roguelike expansion including at least 160 cards, with at least 15 unique achievements and 145 buffed Item and Ability cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Erinthor Mountains
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tripping up each step, the wyverstones pulsing and shimmering around you, you break to catch your breath. The howling wind warns you to stay off this next path - an arduous balance across a thin bridge of stone, with a plummet to sharp crags waiting beneath. But it is the only way forward, the only way beyond the grasps of the Crimsonclaw Wyvern that has been on the hunt for the past two days.

Your comrades apparently weren’t enough to sate its belly. Steeling your resolve, you press your first foot into the stone, testing its strength. Step... step... step, ever forward you creep blasted by the tumultuous winds, until at its midpoint, a screech rings above the rush of air. There, careening through the clouds above you, its massive black and red form almost a blur, its six burning yellow eyes locked on your position. You remove your spear and your shield…for a final stand is all you have left.

boardgame.name: Truelife Gift
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Beware the fruit of the Truelife Tree! A fearsome pleasure barge laden with terrible cargo floats and lists, its passengers numb to the wide world outside. Sinister magic permeates the ancient timbers and tiles, ensorcelling all would- be treasure-seekers and scavengers.

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard: Section Boxes
boardgame.description: A set of four ornate hard plastic Section Boxes that hold all dice and cards of each Section.

boardgame.name: Caverns Deep: Encounters 7-15
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caverns Deep is designed to be a difficult challenge, which will surely be fatal to any but the most stalwart, clever, and lucky adventuring parties. Utilizing full-color hand outs, a deadly fungal Infection Deck, dramatic NPCs, a cinematic story, and of course our legendary terrain, this module will create a highly immersive and theatrical experience for everyone at the table.

boardgame.name: John Company: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: 4 custom designs and colors.

boardgame.name: Maui
boardgame.description:
Locals and tourists in Maui are heading to the beach for a chance to find a nice spot to lay their towels and enjoy the amazing view of the Hawaiian ocean. In Maui, you want to find and place beachgoers on your sand so that they create pleasing patterns, while also placing their towels close to the ocean or under the shade of trees or umbrellas to earn the most points. However, getting too close to either of these areas is risky and might ruin their plans!

In the game, you have your own beach board with room for 13 towels, the board has seven rows in which towels can be placed, and during set-up, you randomly place eight umbrellas in designated locations on your board. Each player places one random towel in the left most column of their board; each towel has three different patterns on it. Place six random tiles in the two rows of the market and one sand dollar in each row.

On a turn, either take all the sand dollars from either row of the market or take a towel from the market; towels cost 0, 1, or 2 sand dollars, with those dollars being placed in the market row. When you place a towel, you must match at least one pattern with the towel that's rightmost on your beach board and you want to match as many patterns as possible. For each match you make, you advance that pattern's scoring marker 1-3 spaces on the score board; the closer to the ocean or the shade the more points you score, but if you place part of a towel outside the play area, you're penalized.

If you cover an umbrella, you receive its bonus, whether that's advancing a pattern's scoring marker or receiving one of two types of pearls.

When someone places a towel in the final column of their beach board, you complete the round, then see who's scored the most points from patterns, pearls, and leftover sand dollars, which are each worth a point. Instead of playing with umbrellas, you can flip your beach board to find a septet of sand crabs. Whenever you cover a crab with a towel, the crab crawls onto that portion of the towel, costing you both that pattern and a few points.

boardgame.name: Urge to Dirge
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

We all love a good instrument of torture, right? But how about a dungeon that’s a torturous instrument? Well that’s just what we’ve orchestrated with the Urge to Dirge. Behold…!

This four way intersection is actually a giant musical instrument, designed to torment any who try to pilfer its treasures. Specific floor tiles create the music, and of course can also trigger some delightfully dangerous effects. Let’s take a closer look!

Publisher's blurb:

Sets required to build this encounter:

Starter Dungeon
Passageways - Intersections Pack
Double Doors Pack

boardgame.name: Kobold Cove
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A local druid tells your party of an unnatural pall of smoke that has appeared at a lonely, rocky point on the coast nearby. The druid suspects powerful magic, and fears that the delicate balance of nature has been upset. He offers to loan the PCs his small rowboat for use in investigating, and to give them two specially brewed potions as a reward when they return.

Publisher's blurb:

Sets required to build this encounter:

Erinthor Mountains
Terrain Tray (Water & Stone)

boardgame.name: Harbinger's Hideout
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A week ago a prisoner escaped from the local constable. That same day, three bounty hunters were dispatched after the fugitive. But after two days, they have not returned. The PCs will get paid if they can return the prisoner alive, and bring any news as to what happened to the hunters.

Publisher's blurb:

Sets required to build this encounter:

Encounter 1 - Summoning Chamber
Encounter 2 - Prison Passage
Basic Cavern Set

boardgame.name: Sleeping Gods: Distant Skies (Gamefound Edition)
boardgame.description:
The Gamefound Collector's edition comes in a bigger and nicer box (featuring gold foil and embossing) than the retail edition, features a painted airplane miniature, and includes 3 extra combat dice, 15 metal stamina tokens, a miniature for each of the five playable characters (the retail edition has cardboard standees, also included in the Collector's edition), and the Thunderstorm Isle expansion.

The Gamefound edition was also bundled with the Sleeping Gods: Primeval Peril (Gamefound edition).

Thunderstorm Isle

Thunderstorm Isle is a faraway location outside of the atlas that you can fly to in your plane. It includes 40 adventure and quest cards, a new map, wandering encounters, and a small storybook.

This is a wet and muddy isle filled with danger and mysteries. Also, you must take care not to be struck by lightning in the almost ever-present storms!

You can include this expansion in any of your Distant Skies campaigns, even your first. Unlike the distant locations in the game, Thunderstorm Isle is an entire map with multiple locations. Explore Thunderstorm Isle at any time by using a flight action. To leave the island, simply move to your plane and return to the game atlas.

boardgame.name: Fangs Over Cardington
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unexpected letter arrived addressed to the Commander. She has assigned you to investigate the author of the letter. Ms. Bella Davor, a debutant in exile, claims to be of ancient origins and cursed with a blood disease that prevents her from physically aging. She is being pursued by Echelon agents who wish to study her unique physiology.

Her petition for asylum in Burgundia must be evaluated. You and your team are to verify her claim while preventing enemy agents from foiling your efforts.

boardgame.name: Cloud Giant's Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #57: Cloud Giant's Castle provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the cloud giant castles in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Stone Giant's Cavern
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #58: Stone Giant's Cavern provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the stone giant lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Peanut Butter Belly Time
boardgame.description:
You are peanut butter makers for Nerdy Nuts! Decide what flavors you want to create from Chocolate Marshmallow to Banana Cookie and everything in between, then prepare your jars and collect the right ingredients for your special peanut butter creations. You can add mystery ingredients for extra flavor, but don't push your luck too far or your sweet treats might end up too salty instead!

In Peanut Butter Belly Time, players draft ingredient cards to create jars of peanut butter. Each card also has a scoring rule on it, but only one card will score for each jar. Players may take orders from a central display if they can fulfill them, and an order replaces a jar's normal scoring. Players can also compete for ingredient majority cards.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

boardgame.name: Clash of the Vestiges
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We often seek to find some sort of light and believe there is good somewhere in every situation, but sometimes life has a funny way of showing us just how sinister it can be. Sometimes, there is no light at the end of the tunnel, no silver lining, and no bright side. In this adventure, the characters will find themselves in a web weaved so thick of lies and manipulation that they must make a moral decision, and the lives of many individuals rest in their hands.

Clash of the Vestiges is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-seven characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and digital maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Call of the Chaos Idol
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For years, Jayfeather Outpost served as a home for the small group of woodsmen, rangers, and hunters that kept the wilds of the Barrowwood from encroaching upon the village of Teague’s Reach. But when the son of the general store owner most recently made a routine trek out to the outpost to deliver provisions to the wood wardens, he found the outpost ransacked and its inhabitants nowhere to be found. Fearful for their safety in the absence of the wood wardens’ protections, the people of Teague’s Reach scraped together a reward for anyone who can make sense of the outpost’s fate before whatever force of nature befell the rangers might turn its attention upon their town.

The Call of the Chaos Idol is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-two characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Crystal Carnival
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seekers of dares, dazzlements, and delights!
Appearing before you for just one night
Presenting wonders so remarkable
Come, join us at the Crystal Carnival!

The Crystal Carnival appears only once a year, on the night the barrier between the material plane and the fey plane is at its weakest, and is filled with wonder for young and old. Those who have been to the carnival say the magical experience changes you, that you don't walk out the same person who walked in. Literally.

Unbeknownst to carnival-goers, the location is a secret battleground for two nagas, who constantly fight for control and ownership of the carnival. One wishes to use the carnival as a means of harvesting flesh and followers, while the other wishes to use it as a gateway between worlds to promote communication and culture.

When an adventuring group in the area hears of the carnival, someone’s fate is about to change. Will they uncover the truth of the carnival and stop the nagas? Or will they, too, fall victim to its lures and attractions?

The Crystal Carnival is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-six characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and digital maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: The Rise of the Salamander
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flames are the calling card to adventure. Often, they are the herald of battle and the siren of doom, beckoning to adventurers to put on their boots, strap on their blades, and stride out the door. Sometimes, those flames have a sinister origin, coming from an evil place as vile and as dark as the flames are hot. When that happens, what emerges from those flames can threaten an entire plane – but will there be adventurers who can stop it?

The Rise of the Salamander is a fifth-edition compatible adventure for the world's most popular roleplaying game designed for a party of four to six level-five characters. It features read-a-loud text for ease of use and digital maps designed for use on virtual tabletops, such as Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds.

boardgame.name: Fat of the Lamb (Low Fantasy Gaming)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Hunger Must be Sated

Will you survive at the cost of your sanity?
Nerwig Whal stands upon a tall bluff, wind buffeting and blowing his cherry red hair. He clears it from his eyes. To the west, a long line of wagons winds its way towards him. It ascends further and further into the hills and will eventually come to a stop at the appointed place: A site ordained to produce fortune - or so he thinks. “These miners have few options for supplies,” he said. “It takes a bold man to claim a stronghold in these harsh hills … but we will do it. And we will be the sole supplier in these here hills. And we will laugh all the way to the bank!” Fat of the Lamb can be used in conjunction with other modules, with a different campaign, or as a one-shot adventure. Inside Fat of the Lamb you will find:

An adventure suitable for characters of 1st to 3rd level;
A dark fantasy adventure of survival and difficult choices;
An adventure compatible with Low Fantasy Gaming;
And Mental horrors the PCs must endure and overcome!

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 09
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

A helm that appears to turn the wearer into a demon
A masterwork box that can hold royal circlets or other treasure
The sword of a monarch - a symbol of wealth and excess
Fiznard's Folly - is an hour of strength worth being disgusting to everyone?

boardgame.name: The Crossroad Chronicler (Volume 5 - Feb 2021)
boardgame.description: Crossroad Chronicler is a periodic publication focusing on Solo, Gm’less, and Gm-lite Role-Playing Games and resources to play them. Our goal is to bring together some of these people and the materials they produce and collect it all in one place for others interested in the concept. We are the chronicler at the crossroads of others’ journeys, here to share for everyone’s benefit.

boardgame.name: The Crossroad Chronicler (Volume 6 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description: Crossroad Chronicler is a periodic publication focusing on Solo, Gm’less, and Gm-lite Role-Playing Games and resources to play them. Our goal is to bring together some of these people and the materials they produce and collect it all in one place for others interested in the concept. We are the chronicler at the crossroads of others’ journeys, here to share for everyone’s benefit.

boardgame.name: The Crossroad Chronicler Omnibus (Volumes 1-4)
boardgame.description: This product includes the first 4 volumes of the Zine, 169 pages of articles, games, play tools, oracles, superb art, and other solo play materials by a wonderful group of contributors that have allowed the Zine to flourish.

boardgame.name: d66 Random Travelers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

36 random wayfarers and travelers a party that might encounter between destinations. Mysterious magicians, haunted nobles, desperate and out of work adventurers, and much, much more.

boardgame.name: d66 Urban Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

36 random events and encounters suitable for an urban environment in any fantasy campaign. Petty thieves, unscrupulous city officials, tricky merchants, mysterious buckets, and much, much more.

boardgame.name: Scyphos Setting Primer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Introduction to the Hexploratores series and the world of Scyphos, inclusive of all basic information needed to run the setting and understand volumes of Hexploratores, as well as all described 6 - Mile Hexes to date, maps to help contexualize other volumes, and an ever-expanding body of lore and useful notes for the setting. As Hexploratores continues, this volume will be updated to reflect newly discovered regions and information.

Hexploratores is a project with the goal of creating a large fantasy world to explore through 6 mile hexes, either as written or as excised and dropped into other settings, and then to dive deeper into certain hexes on a 1 mile hex scale, providing story hooks, encounters, adventures, and other resources to implement into your games.

boardgame.name: Passerine Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Volume explores the entirety of Passerine Island (hexes 01.01, 00.00, and 01.00 in the Mouth of the Aexine) - an island of songbirds, poachers, cursed orchards, and infectious wizards.

boardgame.name: IronSpike
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to IronSpike, the Black Spear RPG System Resource Document. Black Spear, the bronze-age fantasy role playing game, was already released under an Open Gaming License (the very same as this SRD), but IronSpike represents its core system stripped of any of our Product Identity and all of the fluff and window dressing that makes Black Spear what it is- the metal tip of the spear without the haft, ready to be fitted as necessary. We released this SRD with the explicit intent of enabling others to utilize our hack of the system to create their own content, however they like, subject only to the very broad license of the OGL.

boardgame.name: Lone Spear
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lone Spear includes everything needed to begin solo play of Black Spear RPG


A solo play engine
Generator tools for "dungeons"
Encounter disposition oracles
Various other oracles
A guide to using clock play
Reference and note pages, as well as blank extra pages for notes and record keeping
Random d100 table

boardgame.name: Recusant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Recusant is made for use with Hexploratores, the grand hex crawl setting and supplements, and is intended to allow for low fantasy role play of ordinary folk drawn by duty, obligation, or necessity into dangerous situations- the farmer and citizen soldiers who must endure war, kingly scheming, the dangers of the wild unknown, and monsters of myth and legend. It is built from the Year Zero Engine as its core, albeit with significant changes to the Combat system in particular. Despite these changes, Recusant is intended to be readily reverse-compatible with the Year Zero Engine and most games derived from it.

boardgame.name: Tachyon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:
