Welcome to Tachyon, the RPG of faster than light space travel, ship-to-ship combat, and daring survival against all odds. In Tachyon, the player or players take on the role of the crew of a space-faring Corvette in service to the United Federation, traveling from planet to planet and system to system to carry out the mission assigned to them, and to endure the trials and tribulations that occur along the way. Engage enemy vessels, trade with fellow travelers, solve local system problems, and explore the charted galaxy at faster than the speed of light!

boardgame.name: The Fall of Fenyman's Mining Station
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Feynman’s Mining Station is a mining craft that latches onto asteroids and extracts critical celestial metals needed to maintain humanity’s diaspora in the Vault of Night. It is only one of many such stations, but each represents a significant investment and their loss a material casualty for humanity.

The last communication was received from the station ceased two standard days ago. Something is wrong, but the station is too valuable to simply abandon or scuttle- it must be investigated and recovered, if at all possible, which will require sending a later crew to fully detach it from the asteroid.

What of the crew? Can the station be salvaged? Or is it lost to another mystery of the endless void.

boardgame.name: The Goblin Communes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a distant, sleepy, and neglected corner of the Empire, a one-time burgeoning farming town has shrunk with time into a quiet Thorpe, leaving many ancient fields to be reclaimed by nature and farmsteads and villages to crumble with the ages.

This neglect has led to a number of problems, from bandit-infested roads, beasts stalking the forests, and, most recently, something of a goblin problem. Goblin communities, Communes as they call themselves, are inhabited by ambitious and runaway goblins who have all fled the harshness of nomadic banditry, orcish war machinations, attercrap spider thralldom, or various other sorts of unpleasant and unwilling labor on behalf of more powerful and often rather evil forces.

The goblins have done their best to do no harm and simply get by, but living freely as squatters and without established farms or industry or the skills to quickly establish them has proven difficult, and desperate times have led to desperate acts. While originally neither band had official leadership, making decisions via something….close to a crude democracy, strongarm leaders able to provide have emerged. At first it was mere thievery and holding up vagrants, but the strongarm leaders grew bolder and went too far, attempting a caravan robbery that got out of hand and left folks on both sides dead. Then, in panicked effort to ward off retaliation, they went about collecting hostages- though no one remembered to leave a note about the intention behind kidnapping people...

boardgame.name: The Old Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The player characters find themselves on the Old Road heading north, using the very same path the earliest of explorers and settlers. Their destination, unless you choose to substitute your own, is the Hamlet at the Pass, a small village nestled in the crags of an ancient holy site. Along the way, the party finds themselves intercepted by a party of mutant raiders, eager for an easy prize- ill tidings of woes to come. A bruised and battered party finds themselves at a crossroads, with the choice to carry on, leaving others behind, or come to a valiant rescue. Either way, they come to a grotesque discovery, and must overcome a mysterious threat before continuing on their way to their destination.

boardgame.name: Matches
boardgame.description:
The Whelming Matches factory has burned down, with only this artifact found in the destruction. Cold to touch, it sat amongst the ashen remains of the factory. Why? How? These questions have yet to be unanswered.

Matches is a trick-taking style card game, with a unique spin on scoring and playing. The lead player plays a number card to start the blaze. Each player in turn order must play a card matching that number (which increases the blaze's heat and point value), or a set of cards that equal the value of the card.

A player can choose to pass, upon which they collect points for each of pairs they have played. The last player to pass wins the trick and collects the points on the blaze card...but will NOT score their pairs they have played.

Deciding if you'll get more points from the pairs you've played, or if you need to try and stay in to get the points on the blaze card, is the heart of Matches.

The game also includes optional powerful "Burn Cards" which can be purchased with points. These Burn Cards can have huge impacts on how the game is played, the possibly points to be scored, and the cards in players hands.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rayman Mini
boardgame.description:
Rayman has been shrunk to the size of an ant! To undo this spell, ally with insects, mushrooms, leaves, and other plants and find your way through a marvelous, macro-photographic world.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: TRAILS: Storehouse Badge Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Originally available during the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstater campaign.

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game. The "Storehouse" badge costs 1 less of the card's resource type to earn, for each badge earned previously that turn.

boardgame.name: Ninja Master
忍者マスター
boardgame.description: In Ninja Master, you roll nine dice and exchange ninja and sword items, trying to manage both offense and defense.

boardgame.name: Battle Command Volume I: The Battle of the Bulge and Operation Crusader
boardgame.description:
Building on the innovative gameplay of his Fast Action Battle (FAB) Series, designer Rick Young has reimagined the best parts of FAB to introduce a new game system: Battle Command. The goal of the Battle Command system is to provide a fresh and engaging way for various conflicts across different eras to be fought with minimal time wasted on setup and complex rules, making this both a great introductory system for new and veteran players alike.
Each Battle Command volume includes TWO different games in one box. Volume I brings players to the forests of the Battle of the Bulge, and the sun, heat, and sand of North Africa during Operation Crusader. The design emphasis has been placed on making the game very player-friendly and manageable in its level of scope, difficulty, and time of play. With a low total counter count and density, these quick playing (though still realistic) simulations present players with deep strategy meriting contemplation. A system of map areas has been adopted, and movement has been streamlined.

For those who prefer to use a paper map, or who would like to be able to set up both games side by side, we are including a double-sided paper map along with the double-sided mounted map. This is for those of you who have 3 friends who would like to play, or play at conventions, or just plain prefer a paper map.

Battle Command (BC) is a refinement and simplification of the old Fast Action Battles (FAB) game series. Those familiar with the FAB games will recognize that the scope is the same, with higher echelons, artillery, events, and combat assets that can be assigned as available. FAB however was rules intensive and procedural, and those elements have been streamlined in the BC series. Most players do not need to pick up the rulebook after the first turn or two, as everything you need to play has been printed on the map, including a flow-chart with extended sequence of play so that no turn segment will be overlooked, and your attention will be placed solely on the battle at hand. Special rules needed for each event are printed directly on the event cards, so you can play them and forget them without having to refer to the rulebook.

Components:
Two Rulebooks
220 playing cards (110 per game)
1 double-sided mounted map (34"x22") with one game on each side
1 double-sided paper map (34"x22") with one game on each side
2 counter sheets
4 Player Aids
2 dice

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Advanced Programming
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’ve pushed back the frontier. As your AI makes each TRANSIT into the unlimited depths of space one thing has become clear: You are swiftly reaching the limits of your programming.

Fortunately, there is Advanced Programming to call upon. A New Type of Artificial Intelligence has been developed to improve your fleet. Along with it comes newly designed and discovered abilities with which to improve yourself.

boardgame.name: Dahvil Delivery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An allied HQ [Designation: FURTHERMORE], operating in the neighboring sector of the frontier, has requested assistance. Our allies have begun to expand FURTHERMORE’s sphere of influence by building colonies, but the colony in the Dahvil System has come under attack by a rogue fleet. The exact nature and complete makeup of the rogue fleet is not clear, but its Transit-capable vessels have been attacking supply convoys and its biologics have been raiding the colony itself. They have been classified as pirates.

boardgame.name: Ghost Ship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strange transmission from space. Missing ships. Is Decken sector haunted?

There's only one way to find out. Send the fleet and see if it can survive the Ghost Ship.

boardgame.name: DUO
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DUO est un jeu de rôles minimaliste émergeant pour une joueuse et une conteuse. Développez à deux des histoires pleines de rebondissement et explorez l'âme du personnage en jouant sur ses faiblesses.

DUO partage la narration entre la joueuse et la conteuse. Si au moment approprié le résultat du jet de dés est en faveur de la joueuse, elle prend la narration, si le résultat est négatif c'est la meneuse. Si le résultat est incertain, la joueuse prend la main mais la meneuse ajoute des coûts ou des complications.

boardgame.name: 구사록 946 - The Cat's Story
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

수록 시나리오 1. 스태그필드

너한테 영원토록 증오를 받아도 좋아,
네가 그만큼 나를 생각한다면.

당신은 영국 잉글랜드 남부에 위치한 명문 사립 고등학교(식스폼 컬리지)인 스태그필드의 13학년 학생입니다.
최근 룸메이트로 새롭게 배정된 KPC는 학교 제일의 문제아인데다가, 어쩐지 수상쩍습니다.

2년이 지나고 나서야 새롭게 알게 된 학교의 비밀도 썩 호의적으로 받아들이기는 힘듭니다.
당신은 룸메이트와 학교에 얽힌 비밀을 풀어나갈 수 있을까요?

잊지 마세요, 무사히 살아나가기 위해서는 학칙을 지켜야 합니다.

boardgame.name: TAG: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Get points, draw strategically, and freeze the competition; all while avoiding the dreaded IT card!

Players will play and discard cards to rapidly match T, A, and G cards to make sets. The deck is the main source of cards, but if you're lucky, someone may discard a card that you could use!

Sometimes, you'll draw a Special Card instead of a letter card. Depending on which one you get, they can be great for attacking the competition or defending yourself!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Level Up System Reference Documents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The contents of the Level Up System Reference Documents (LUSRDs) below are designated as Open Gaming Content (OGC) as defined by the Open Gaming License v1.0a (OGL). You may copy, modify, or distribute the contents of these documents under the terms set out on the OGL. It is your responsibility to ensure that you are familiar with and understand the OGL before using this material. Any content from any Level Up book, PDF, website, tool, or other publication not included in the LUSRDs is not Open Gaming Content.

boardgame.name: Curse of the Alta Silva
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Alta Silva Resort, your relaxing retreat from the hectic pace of modern life. Ignore the rumors. It's perfectly safe here.

The brochure sounded so promising. You were just there for a party. A vacation. A company retreat. It was supposed to be relaxing. Fun. Maybe educational. A chance to recharge.

But now? Evil is on the loose. People are dead. People you cared about. More people are going to die.

Why? Who, or what, is killing you all? Can you stop it? Can you survive the night? Are you next?

Curse of the Alta Silva is a narrative storytelling roleplaying game in the tradition of classic slasher movies and surviving a night far from help. Evil Dead, Friday the 13th, Halloween, Child's Play, and Nightmare on Elm Street all rank high in the list of inspirations. There is no GM. You are in charge of your own doomed and bloody fate. To play, you will need several d6s, a d8, and copies of the included character sheet.

boardgame.name: VEN6 System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

VEN6 is a roleplaying game system specifically designed to create narrative storytelling roleplaying games with conflict mechanics and a GM option. Players choose traits that define their character. Where those traits overlap reveals the characters' skills.

Characters are built on four Traits, four Skills, two Relationships, and one Group. Take those bits, polish it up with an Archetype and some details and you will have a character.

boardgame.name: Runic System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Runic System Reference Document is derived from RuneQuest SRD Luxury Edition and compatible with RuneQuest II, though is has all product identity (and setting) removed and is intended for generic/universal use in creating new system derivatives.

Runic System Reference Document is provided under Open Game License.

boardgame.name: Make Your Character Matter
boardgame.description:
"No story is more engaging than yours!
What makes a D&D adventure exciting? No other story is more engaging than your character’s story! This book presents a simple and direct seven-step approach for you and your group to make your characters the stars of your D&D adventures.

If you love roleplaying and storytelling, this book is for you. It explores a simple but powerful idea: campaign plots should be created starting from the player characters’ backstories, and not the other way around.

These seven steps will take your D&D adventures to the magical excitement and deep immersion we experience with the epic tales and narratives of humankind.

Make Your Character Matter will take you, step by step and using clear examples, in what you need to co-create with your friends the adventure of your lives.

This book comes with six exclusive original characters and backstories, presented in a revamped character sheet designed for campaigns with a strong focus on roleplaying and storytelling."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Starjammer SRD
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Starjammer System Reference Document presents the open game content under Open Game License. The SRD retains a generic science fiction genre and the Starjammer setting, and incorporates open gaming materials from multiple publishers.

boardgame.name: The OpenD6 System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The OpenD6 System Reference Document is presented as in wiki format, along with various additional resources, including some download links.

The SRD is designed to support Adventure, Fantasy, and Space genre play.

The SRD is provided under Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 License.

boardgame.name: Reclaim the Wild: System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Legend of Zelda series of video games have been part of the gaming landscape since the beginning of Nintendo’s video gaming consoles. They feature a unique blend of exploration, fantasy, and heroic adventure, which harkens back to the stories of knights and kings battling dragons and demons, rescuing princesses, and saving the world from untimely ends.
...
Reclaim the Wild contains all the rules you need to start playing, but how you approach it might depend on your familiarity with Breath of the Wild and with Zelda titles in general.

User summary:

The System Reference Document is derived from - and very similar to - Reclaim the Wild.
boardgame.rpg: The Legend of Zelda: Reclaim the Wild

boardgame.name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Fungal Dwarves Faction Deck
boardgame.description:
Cultivate your colony of spore warriors with the Fungal Dwarves! Nurture the cycle of growth and decay to overwhelm the enemy summoner with an unending chain of fungal fighters! Kuldak is the centerpiece of the fungal colony, converting death into growth for his nearby allies.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Summoner Wars Second Edition Fungal Dwarves Faction

boardgame.name: Lawyer Up: Divorce
boardgame.description:
The Divorce case expansion focuses on a high profile celebrity divorce case between a billionaire tech CEO and 90s Television Star. This is a more symmetrical case with each player taking on the role of one of the celebrities of the marriage. You can play as a Sam, the super rich tech CEO or as Adrian, the TV celebrity. Both Sam and Adrian's cards are dual-sided male/female so you can create any kind of marriage/relationship that you prefer.

One of the new mechanics in this case are secret Attitude cards. Each of these cards represents the emotional state of each partner and matches one of the bias symbols in the game. It's possible for your attitude to change throughout the course of the divorce proceedings but each one gives you extra victory points for marital assets with the matching bias symbol on them.

The other big change for the Divorce case is that you'll be fighting over (and swaying) marital asset cards rather than the jury. Each Asset card is double-sided and has an asymmetrical track where you can spend influence to sway bias. The victory point values on each asset are scored by the player who wins the asset (if in their color) but assets can also be shared between players. This allows the Divorce case to be played competitively or cooperatively based on the strategies chosen by each side leading to amicable splits, financial victories, or spiteful losses. Will you compromise for the sake of the children or drag each other through the mud to get the most assets?

boardgame.name: Lawyer Up: Private Eye
boardgame.description:
The Private Eye Case expansion sees the defense take on the role of private investigator in a 1950s Hollywood noir setting where they have been framed for the murder of a popular film star. The private eye will need to divide their time between investigating clues to solve the real murder and defending themselves in court. The prosecution works with conspirators and ring leaders to gain red herrings to hinder this investigation.

This case features a lot of new mechanics that shake up the core game. As the defense, you will be working to reveal cards from clue decks to discover WHO murdered the starlet with WHAT weapon WHERE in the city. Like the game Clue, each clue card eliminates one of the possibilities. The dilemma is that in order to investigate and reveal clues, you will need to play evidence cards for their Investigation effect instead of using them in the courtroom to influence the jury. If the Private Eye is able to correctly guess the murderer, weapon and crime scene they will win the game, but they need to make sure that they don't ignore the trial where the chips are stacked against them.

The prosecution represents a vast conspiracy of witnesses trying to frame the private investigator. Their goal is clearly focused on winning the trial and they will do their best to draft and utilize planted evidence in the courtroom. The prosecution will earn Red Herring tokens as they sway and manipulate the jury which they can place on the clue decks to hinder the PI's investigation.

boardgame.name: Lawyer Up: Casino Heist
boardgame.description:
A team of thieves and swindlers have taken the Majestic Casino for all its worth. The suspects were rounded up easy enough, but proving their guilt conclusively will be difficult. The defendants seem overly confident within the court room. Is it just a façade as their scheme crumbles down around them? Or do they have one last trick up their sleeves?

In the Heist case, the prosecution is attempting to convict a majority of the gang responsible for the heist while the defense is doing their best to get as many swindlers exonerated as possible. These defendants are running the long con! Throughout the case they will be dealt double-sided Con cards. Players will be competing to assign these Cons to defendants and flip them to the side that benefits them the most. A defendant's trial is resolved and scored when they complete their long con and are dealt 3 Con cards. It is essential to deal the final Con to the defendant's you're winning to score them. The player who convicts or exonerates the most defendants wins.

boardgame.name: Lawyer Up: Solo Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Solo Expansion expands on the solo mode in the base game by adding a new solo base deck, a bias die, Automa personality cards, and case-specific card effects that work with every case released thus far. If you're a player looking to get into the nitty gritty of the rules, read on!

The new Solo Base Deck is shuffled together with the drafted case cards for the Automa. All the effects on these cards have been written with solo play in mind. The Automa's procedures act like traps that players will have to work around.

The Automa is further expanded with additional cards that let players build an Automa player. By selecting a Personality card, a Discovery card, and the Questioning card corresponding to the Automa’s role in the selected case, there are tons of unique Automa effects and combinations to explore.

The new Automa rules reduce die rolling and create unique puzzles to work around each witness as players will want to avoid triggering procedures and sidebar abilities that can set them back.

boardgame.name: OléMains!
boardgame.description:
Put a card on your forehead and your team must make you guess it. As soon as the word is found, you take another card. You got 1 minute to guess as many as you can. Then, the other team do the same, on the same theme.

9 themes in total on each, they'll compete. Celebrities, songs, trademarks, sports... there is a theme for each and everyone of you. You'll have to mime, hum, describe... each theme has its own rule.

And not so fast... On each theme, you'll draw a card as a handicap. Try to mime with your elbow stuck against your body, then you'll realise how funny it is.

As you can see, OléMains! is a fun party game !

boardgame.name: Śpiochy
boardgame.description:
Śpiochy ("Sleepyheads") is a game that helps the youngest children calm down and prepare to sleep.
The players close their eyes as one of the adorable animals falls asleep under the quilt.
Which animal was it? What was the color of the quilt? Which toy was it playing with during the day?

The game offers flexible difficulty levels and several gameplay variants (including a competitive one).

Large animal tiles, charming artwork, and three-dimensional bed bring a unique experience to the little ones.

Śpiochy to gra, która utuli do snu każde dziecko. Wyciszy najmłodszych graczy
i sprawi, że kładzenie się do łóżeczka stanie się jeszcze przyjemniejsze.

Kilka wariantów rozgrywki, przepiękne ilustracje zwierzątek i trójwymiarowe łóżeczko zauroczą wszystkich małych śpiochów.

boardgame.name: The Sunken Temple
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Called the Saints’ House, it sits far out from a fort in low hills. Generally people avoid it; it is not a place of worship and no one mourns the Saints who have passed, given death is necessary for the status of sainthood. However, that does not stop the rumors swirling in the fort: those men and women who do pilgrimage to the temple return with healed wounds and hearts; blessed bones are found just inside, sold for a fortune; a priest wandering the halls who casts out the ruin from a weary traveler’s soul.

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops Second Strike (5th Edition)
boardgame.description:
In the game, you can now play as Tactical Police Units, Special Forces, Law Enforcement, ICO Ghosts, PMCs and more.
The 5e rules have been adapted to fit the modern military setting:


New rules regarding weapons, including calibres and attachments
New Class rules with level features including new skill proficiencies
No subclasses now you choose the Feature you wish your operator to have from a list meaning more diversity amongst characters of the same class.
Rules for safe houses and supply drops
New rules for requisitioning equipment
New rules for using Inspiration
All the rules you need to play in a single book


You can choose from 23 different background countries and 94 different specialist law enforcement and military units making this the biggest Ghost Ops yet.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Bordélocratie
boardgame.description:
Bordélocratie is a game that puts players at the heart of the French political "bordel" (or shambles). Find yourself at the head of a political party that will leave its mark on the Fifth Republic (or maybe just a dent).

But to reach the supreme position of President and get to move into the Elysée palace, you must first increase your popularity, get more votes in the Assemblée et vote laws for the good of your part... country !

Designed as a party game that can also be played in a more political version (longer, more intense and with more knives stuck in your back by the end), a game lasts around 1 hour and brings to the table 4 to 6 fans of the best televised political debate of the Fifth Republic, or 4 to 6 players who want to feel powerful while disdaining your nobody opponents (until they become somebody).

HOW TO PLAY

Every turn, players draw 2 Action cards then can only play one.
Then the First Player draws three Bills, submits one to the Assemblée and draws a second random one.
Players vote on the Bills submitted (each one giving victory points to player based on specific conditions).
Then the turn end and we start again.

THE ACTION CARDS

The Action cards you get to use have different abilities. Events change the course of the game, Campaign increases your popularity and backers bring you more weight at the Assemblée. You can also play fraud cards to turn the tide in your favor, or rip the tide away from another player.

ELECTIONS

Mimicking the Constitution of the French Fifth Republic (with a few liberties of course) every 5 turns, a President will be elected in a two round system. In the first round only the two players with the most popularity get to the second round. Then for the second round, every other players has to endorse one of the two finalists and lend them their own popularity.

WINNING

At the end of turn 12, it's time to see who collected the most victory points through being elected or Bills that gave your points based on the backers you have accumulated.

Of course there is much more to discover in the cards and positions within the government, but that's for you to discover in the game !

—description from the designer (English)

Bordélocratie est un jeu qui vous plongera dans le bordel politique de la Ve République. Vous aurez l'occasion d'incarner de grands partis qui marqueront l'histoire du pays et qui vous propulserons au sommet : à l'Élysée !

Mais pour ça, il vous faudra réunir des soutiens de tout bord, avoir plus de voix à l'Assemblée, voter des lois et faire campagne.

Créé comme un party game qui peut être joué en version politicarde (plus longue, plus intense, avec plus de couteaux dans le dos), une partie dure environ 1h et réuni autour d'une même table entre 4 et 6 personnes, passionnées des grands débats télévisés de la Ve République ou simplement qui veulent à leur tour se sentir puissant·e·s tout en méprisant leurs adversaires politiques qui ne sont rien (jusqu'à-ce qu'ils ou elles le deviennent).

COMMENT JOUER

Chaque tour, tout le monde pioche 2 cartes Action puis en joue une seule.
Ensuite, le ou la Premier·e joueur·euse pioche 3 cartes Loi et en propose une à l’Assemblée avant d’en tirer une 2e qui est soumise aussi à l’Assemblée.
Tout le monde vote sur les propositions de Loi (chacune donne des points de victoire selon des conditions spécifiques).
Puis le tour se termine et on passe au suivant.

LES CARTES ACTION

Les cartes Action que vous pouvez utiliser ont plusieurs rôles. Les Événements changent le cours du jeu, les Campagne vous permettent d’augmenter votre popularité et les Soutiens vous apportent plus de Voix à l’Assemblée. Vous pouvez aussi jouer des cartes Fraude pour tirer la couverture à vous, ou la retirer d’une autre personne qui la veut pour elle ou lui.

ÉLECTIONS

En imitant la Constitution de la Ve République (avec quelques libertés bien sûr) tous les 5 tours un·e Président·e est élu·e dans un système à deux tours. Au premier, seules les deux personnes avec le plus de Popularité passent au second. Puis, pour le second tour, tout le monde qui n’a pas passé le premier doit soutenir un·e des deux finalistes en leur prêtant sa popularité.

GAGNER

À la fin du 12e tour, c’est l’heure de trouver un·e vainqueur. La personne avec le plus de points de victoire (obtenus par des élections ou des Lois) gagne le jeu, la politique et toute la République.

Il y a bien sûr encore plus à découvrir dans ce jeu, à travers les cartes, les rôles au sein du gouvernement etc, mais ça c’est à vous de le découvrir !

—description from the designer (French)

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Joint Task Force
boardgame.description:
“Exitus Acta Probat”
The outcome justifies the deed.

Emblazoned on the coat of arms of President George Washington, and carried now on the unit insignia of the Joint Special Operations Feasibility Studies Group, also known as Joint Task Force Chimera. The men and women selected to take part in JTF- Chimera are expected to live that creed, not to just do what needs to be done, but to be willing to sacrifice whatever it takes for mission accomplishment.

JTF is a setting for the Ghost Ops Modern Day Covert Ops RPG; taking the multinational ICO of the original and replacing it with a more focused view of military special operations. This book contains:


New Backgrounds and Packages: based on real-world US Special Operations Forces.
A Streamlined Armory and Motorpool: consisting of a selection of what members of SOCOM would field.
A Reputation Point System: replacing dollars with the only currency Operators truly care about, respect.
A Replacement of the Safehouse Mechanic: offering a more “militarized” version.
A slew of Optional Rules: allowing you to customize the difficulty and realism of your game experience.
Operation Viper Blue: a short, dynamic campaign intended to prepare both Game Master and Player alike to the changes in the Feral System.


Take on the challenge of bringing up a new SOCOM unit from conception to Tier One status, or take on the roles of your favourite Delta Force or DEVGRU operators as they separate the wheat from the chaff on the modern battlefield. JTF is intended to complement Ghost Ops Core for those seeking a more military setting.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Operation Glow Worm
boardgame.description:
You are sent to to the city Pripyat, devastated by the Chernobyl disaster the city is now patrolled by Russian troops, is host to Dark Tourism and Ukrainian organised crime.

When a group of Dark Tourists are taken hostage it's normally local authorities that need to deal with it, but when one of those hostages is the son of a French Ambassador and there is a reason to believe that the local Russian military is turning a blind eye, the ICO and your team are called.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Operation Greenacre
boardgame.description:
It is Xmas Eve and a Shopping Mall is sieged by Terrorists
With over 60 hostages and a number of explosive devices placed around the Mall, the terrorists are determined to ruin Xmas whilst getting rich. The police are called but fearing a panic on the Holidays it is felt a more covert approach is needed.

Your team will need to infiltrate the Shopping Mall, save the hostages and defuse the bombs, you have been given the all-clear to act with extreme prejudice in regards to the terrorists, so get in there save some civilians and remove a few bad guys from Santa's naughty list!

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Operation Manitou
boardgame.description:
You are sent on one of the hardest missions of your career, you must break a war criminal out of Guantanamo Bay to face justice in the Middle East. You will face soldiers ordered to shoot to kill except this time you can not fire back.

A total Stealth No-Kill mission for Ghost Ops RPG.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Operation Dawn Red
boardgame.description:
Today was to be a normal day, get up, head to college, hang out with friends, normal stuff, but nothing ever turns out as you expect. You awaken to see parachutes filling the sky, men in military gear with weapons rounding up your neighbours, the sounds of shouting in a language you do not recognise.
Is this a dream, or has your town actually been invaded by an enemy force?

Operation: Dawn Red is a homage to one of the best invasion movies ever made, and then remade, Red Dawn. In the movie the USA is invaded by an enemy force, the story revolves around a small town and how a group of young liberators fight back, well now you are those liberators, and it is your town being invaded!

Operation: Dawn Red is a sourcebook to run the iconic movie with either established operators with a safe house in the area, or as young civilians fighting back, you could even mix the two.

Inside the sourcebook you will find:


Instructions on how to run an Operation: Dawn Red in your town
Rules for creating young civilian characters.
Gear and Weapon list available to civilians in a captured town.
Maps and rules for Prison Camps, Power Stations and Radio and TV studios, along with roadblocks, curfews, key infrastructure, collaborators etc.



So if you have ever wondered what it would be like to have an invasion force enter your town and what you and your friends would do about it, now is your chance.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: Sydney (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
A fan expansion for Ticket to Ride based on the train and bus networks in the city of Sydney, Australia.

Map background created by Stamen Design and used under CC BY 3.0

boardgame.name: Eldritch Sands Module & Threat Cards
boardgame.description:
The Module and Threat card set contains 50 cards, giving players and Game Masters access to the modules and threats of the Eldritch Sands campaign setting on the fly.

The Eldritch Sands campaign setting is needed to make use of this product.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fey Encounters Solo Cards
boardgame.description:
This deck of cards is designed for solo, dmless players to experience the Fey Encounters (5E) supplement without requiring an oracle or dealing with spoilers. Each card offers the player the ability to consider their choices before turning to the appropriate page in the book to resolve the encounter. The cards also include keywords for players that make use of them when journaling their adventures.

Not a Stand-Alone Product. The PDF or Hardcover version of Fey Encounters is Required for these Solo Cards.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Play with Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Show Off at the Gaming Table!

Whether you are a novice player looking for guidance on how to master the intricacies of your very first character or a seasoned TTRPG veteran seeking a few new tricks and tips to give you an edge during adventuring, Play with Class has all the insights into running successful 5th Edition personas. From barbarians to wizards, from level 1 to 20, each class is covered in detail, top to bottom.

This 24-page treatise includes:

A quick study of each class’s role within the adventuring group
Fun reasons to play
A combat crash course to optimize efficiency in battle
Guidance on the right choices to make as you level up
Interesting options for different class flavors


Find your favorite alter ego and play it to perfection at your next session with Play With Class!

boardgame.name: The Incompleat Olden Lands
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Incompleat Olden Lands includes the following sections, some more complete than others:

Humans of the Olden Lands (Complete)
Demi-Humans of the Olden Lands (Complete)
Humanoids of the Olden Lands (Complete)
Languages of the Olden Lands (Complete)
Political Divisions of the Olden Lands (Various levels of completion)
Geography of the Olden Lands (Various levels of completion)
Complete Monster List by Area (Complete)
Complete Resource List by Type (Complete)
Coinage by Realm (Complete)
Titles and Order of Precedence (Very Incomplete)
Gods of the Olden Lands (Incomplete List Only)

boardgame.name: The Sands of Despair (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Recent seismic events unearth a long buried tomb in the desert, and the locals fear that a long dead tyrant's last words may come true...

The Sands of Despair is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition side trek for 6th level characters, designed to be completed in a single session (more or less). This adventure could be run in a single session, maybe more depending on how much the players interact with the environment.

The adventure is set inside a mummy's tomb and contains at most three major traps/hards and four encounters, culminating in meeting Iryk-Tep, Mummy Lord of Mejdul.

boardgame.name: Meeros Doomed
boardgame.description:
The City State of Meeros lies broken. Queen Herathos wants the renegade priestess, Kara, brought to justice to atone for her treachery. The characters are tasked with venturing to distant Kopash, and charged with making her arrest.

But is all as it seems? Powerful forces are plotting to destroy Meeros completely, and those who have protected the city may well be the ones who secure its doom.

The characters must uncover traitors, travel into monster-infested swamps, confront sorcerous fiends, and perhaps even ally themselves with Meeros' ancient foes, the Badoshi Warlords, if they are to avenge the Doom that has come to Meeros!

This mini-campaign follows on directly from events found in the Mythras core rules, and the scenarios Sarinaya's Curse, and Meeros Falling, although it can also be played stand-alone.

Possession of the Mythras core rulebook is recommended.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Rainbow Pets
boardgame.description:
Everyone loves animals, especially puppies! But you even more so. And that's why you're off to the world's most exotic destinations in search of the cutest little ones.

Rainbow Pets is a cute, simultaneous pick and choose game where you play together, with a turn-based pick and bluff mechanism.

Players, each turn, choose six puppies to bet on with inverted tokens, to vote hidden: three of them (depicting a paw on one side) are real, while the remaining (blank) are bluffs. When all players have finished their tokens, they proceed to reveal them; bluffs are discarded. If only one player has a valid token on the card, the puppy is adopted by the owner, adding at the end of the game the victory points indicated at the top of the card. If several tokens are placed on the puppy card by different players, the puppy is cuddled, producing the effect shown at the bottom of the card. Adopted puppies are replaced in the same number by other cards. The winner is the one who, at the end of three rounds, has the most victory points.

boardgame.name: Runecairn: Advanced Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Berserkr. Ferocious and powerful, wade into battle with no armour upon your back, wielding a massive two-handed sword and call upon the power of beasts to strengthen your attacks.

Pyre. Shape flame as a blacksmith shapes iron, calling upon ravenous fire to burn and purge and channel primal forces through your own two hands.

Balance favour and sorrow or read the runes to guide your way solo through a pre-written adventure, or conjure a random dungeon crawl with the delve generator.

Navigating the world of Nine Realms can be a lonely endeavour, but thankfully there are kindred spirits available to assist with jolly cooperation.


Runecairn: Advanced Rules is a 20-page, black and white tabletop RPG supplement for Norse fantasy roleplaying game Runecairn, adding new starting classes and optional rules. Runecairn is based on Cairn by Yochai Gal, with streamlined rules, fast character creation, and gameplay based on exploration and player choice.

Advanced Rules Includes:

2 new advanced starting classes: Berserkr, Pyre
New options for solo play with a rune-based oracle
New random delve generator for creating Norse dungeons
New options for 3 or more players with summoned allies and invasions

boardgame.name: 100 Low Fantasy Curses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remember that time you got cursed and horns started growing on your forehead?

With our list of 100 Low Fantasy Curses, prepare for the worst every time you get cursed...

This product:
- contains 100 curses, each with an original name and the description of its effects

boardgame.name: Hush: Box
boardgame.description:
Medium Stout Box (Full Box Printed)

This game is released throughout the year in a starter kit and 6 monthly episodes. A box for the whole game is being released through The Game Crafter.

boardgame.name: Dino Draft
boardgame.description:
Stegosaurus, triceratops, brachiosaurus and pterodactyls are out in force!

Aim of the game: Score the maximum number of points. Choose carefully as the cards are passed from player to player, as you can only pick one card each turn.

At the beginning of the game, the players receive 2 "mission" cards, colors and types of dinosaurs. For Every card in a player's hand with the same colour or dinosaur as their "mission" cards at the end of the game, the plaer scores 1 point.

The game is played over several "pick and pass" rounds: during these rounds, the players receive cards and each turn, each player chooses any one card to keep, before passing the remaining hand to the player on their left.

After the final round of "pick and pass", each player counts their points from the cards in front of them.

boardgame.name: Hush: The Evergreen Pass
boardgame.description:
March 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Evergreen Pass
Character card: Zoella
Nocturnal Creature card: Czibo
Spirit card: Skeleton Spirit

boardgame.name: World of Aetaltis: Divine Inspiration Cards
boardgame.description:
The Divine Inspiration Cards are a deck of 52 cards that add a divine twist to the way you use Inspiration in your Fifth Edition adventures. Complete rules for the use of Divine Inspiration Cards are availble in the World of Aetaltis: Gamemaster's Guide.

The World of Aetaltis us an amazing new game world designed for use with the Fifth Edition of the world’s best-known roleplaying game. In Aetaltis, you’ll unlock a setting that rekindles the fire of classic heroic fantasy game worlds. It’s everything that made fantasy RPGs such an incredible phenomenon, reimagined and refreshed for today’s gamers.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Awakening of Cerberus
ケルベロスの覚醒
boardgame.description:
In Greek mythology, it is said that a young man named Orpheus used the "tone of the lyre" to put Cerberus to sleep, and in The Awakening of Cerberus, all three heads start the game asleep.

The two players want to collect all the souls of their allies while not losing their own lives in the process. To that end, it is important for you to co-ordinate your strategies since Cerberus may wake if the strategy shifts. An awakened Cerberus head will attack to re-capture the souls it has collected, but you can possibly send it back to sleep. Due to the darkness of the Netherworld, however, free communication between the players is restricted.
boardgame.boardgameartist: Yuki Nakamura (なかむら ゆき)

boardgame.name: Buen Camino
boardgame.description:
For centuries, the Camino de Santiago has brought together pilgrims from all over the world who, for different reasons, decide to undertake their journey year after year.
Be the first to arrive at the Cathedral of Santiago and win.

In Buen Camino, two to four players will competitively build and move through the "camino" - the way of Saint James. In a turn, players usually place a "camino" path card, play an event card or move their piece to another card. Some cards have events (blisters, storms, etc), others activities (time to eat, walk with someone, etc), and even equipment (map, raincoat, etc).
The first piece to reach the Santiago de Compostela Cathedral Place wins!

boardgame.name: The Wavestone Monolith
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:
Fear the silence, the water, the dark stone itself!

Deep within the sweltering jungle, a monolith of black basalt floats upon an undulating lake hidden in a cave. They say inhuman howls emanate from it on moonless nights... and that the fat gems and coins of a lost society lie inside for the taking!

boardgame.name: The Warlock of Blackpool
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Warlock of Blackpool is a one-shot adventure for D&D 5E targeted to characters levels 5-7. It is designed as a non-specific setting so that you can insert it as a brief detour into any approved campaign-in-progress where adventurers are traveling through mountains or forests. It also introduces the powerful NPC Dorian Cad'Fael, The Warlock of Blackpool, who will play a prominent role in future additional modules of a new overall campaign entitled The Legend of Blackpool.

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#9 - Devil's Breach - First Contact)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Blaster Bolts features

Devil's Breach - First Contact- sci-fi writer Walt Robillard brings us an exciting tale of space marines clashing with demonic forces.
The Devil's Prototype - The PCs must navigate a remote research facility overrun by demons in this sci-fi horror adventure for the White Star RPG. By Jason Sunday. Contains a bestiary with new infernal foes.

boardgame.name: Cargo Handling
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When speeder trucks or freighters can’t quite carry enough, Vehicle Ops: Cargo Handling has solutions. This supplement contains house rules on cargo containers, overloading vehicles, and a more logical system for carrying vehicles aboard another.

boardgame.name: Consumables & Expenses
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Operating and living aboard a starship can be costly. Vehicle Ops: Expenses sheds some light on vehicle consumables and making your ship your home.

boardgame.name: Repairs & Wear
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Repairs come in many forms depending on what is being fixed: System Strain, Hull Trauma, Components, or optional Wear. Repairs can range from simple rebooting of systems to routine maintenance to major work being done at a starport.

Most repair rules are covered in the Core rulebooks, but they are spread out and sometimes contradictory. Below you will find the core system summarized (with some house rule tweaks) along with expanded Spare Parts, Salvage, and Wear rules.

boardgame.name: Signals Intel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rules for sensors and communications in Fantasy Flight Game’s Star Wars RPG’s are sparse and sometimes contradictory. Rules described by one piece of gear are often quite different than those described for a similar piece of gear. Some gear or attachments makes others completely obsolete and non-desirable. Communications or “comms” of huge, expensive vehicles are limited to 100’s of kilometers while a cheap, portable comm can reach across light-years.

This document attempts to alleviate these problems without making too many actual changes or, “house rules”. Yet, some are still needed. But, most of this document still involves clarifications and examples when possible over changing of the rules-as-written, or “RAW”.

Don’t be scared of its length. The rules below are actually quite limited. The explanation and examples make it lengthy.

boardgame.name: Star Journeys
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Travel amongst the stars is a complex business, whether it be for trade, pleasure, or adventure. Vehicle Ops: Star Journeys, details astrogation, sublight travel, & starports a ship crew may encounter during their travels.

boardgame.name: Clone Wars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Clone Wars (22-19 BBY), occasionally referred to as the Clone War or the Separatist War, was the name given to the three-year war between the Galactic Republic and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The war is named after the clone troopers, used by the Republic against the Confederacy's battle droids. The Grand Army of the Republic an the Separatist Droid Army were the two of the largest in galactic history, and fighting between them rapidly spread throughout the galaxy.

boardgame.name: The Complete Species Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

About four years in the making, The Complete Species Guide is the ultimate source for species selection during character creation, featuring over 300 species and counting. Similar to FFG’s books, every species has stats, a picture, and information pertaining to their physiology, society, homeworld, and language. The CSG is incredibly comprehensive, including every official FFG species, every species from the Ultimate Alien Anthology, Unofficial Species Menagerie, Alien Anthology, Galaxy Guide 4: Alien Races, Galaxy Guide 12: Aliens-Enemies and Allies, or the New Essential Guide to Alien Species, as well as many other species.

boardgame.name: Deploy the Fleet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

War! For the second time in a generation, the stars are thrown into turmoil as the galaxy convulses with civil war; the oppressive navy of the Galactic Empire strives to crush the fleet of the Rebel Alliance. Inamongst this epic conflict, pirates and criminal syndicates thrive, threatening the shipping that is the lifeblood of galactic society free from retribution. But military conflict and criminal endeavours are not the only threats to the honest spacers, as many creatures call the darkness of space their home - some benign if treated well, but others ancient and terrible.

boardgame.name: End of the Line
boardgame.description:
An Unofficial Sourcebook for the Minos Cluster

From the introduction:

Sylvest Trev’hec stepped out of the transport and into the open starport of Gallisport. A grimy haze hung over the city. This wasn’t where he’d go if he had a choice. But, this is where the leads to his sister’s whereabouts led, so this is where he came. But now that he was here, he wasn’t sure where to start.

boardgame.name: The Warlock Returns - Issue #06 (Q1/22)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

This issue brings you new material for fans of the Advanced Fighting Fantasy Roleplaying game and the Fighting Fantasy gamebooks.

Published four times a year, this issue contains:

Denizens of the Pit - A dangerous dozen of creatures
Jungle - Poisons and Diseases from the jungles of Titan
Advanced Fighting Fantasy Online - The online AFF experience explained
Cantrip Spell Cards - For use with your magic users
Scorpion Swamp - The Masters - Setting setup
Stellar Adventures - Space Ranger solo game
Stellar Adventures - Double-Double Cross short story
The Legend of Gareus: Comic strip and agony aunt page
New Races: Black Elves and the Bird People
Director advice articles suggesting rumours and plot hooks
Plus the results of the Warlock Returns charity auction
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Denizens of the Pit: A Dangerous Dozen
Random Events for the Planes of the Pit
You are a Space Ranger, Scourge of Pirates!

boardgame.name: Throne of Under
boardgame.description:
Throne of Under is a strategic, turn-based table-top adventure game. Two to four players move their characters on the map across sixteen lands to the very last land. Players use the playing cards to move, battle faerumentals: the monsters of these lands, and challenge opponents. The goal is to be the first one to collect four keys to open the Throne room, enter it and win the last battle.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Veiled Fate: Kickstarter Exclusive Age and City Cards
boardgame.description: 6 additional Age cards and 6 additional City cards that were given to backers of the campaign.

boardgame.name: The Grand Carnival: On the Road
boardgame.description:
The carnivals in this town just got even bigger! Clowns, enormous attractions, golden tickets, and more peanuts than you can handle, all arriving by train in the next week. And you’re taking this show on the road, stopping in cities across the ol’ US of A. Can you create the greatest carnival this country has ever seen?

This expansion introduces multiple modules to add to your games of The Grand Carnival, as well as new Tricks of the Trade cards to play with. And for more variety, players can choose a unique city to visit, which have different scoring conditions for players to shoot for.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Eternal Council Faction Deck
boardgame.description:
The Eternal Council's summoner Praefectus Edia welcomes you to study alongside her, moving from the academy to the battlefield! With her quick wit and knack for research, Edia can rapidly draw through your deck and combine your event cards in a way that will surely teach your foe a lesson!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Summoner Wars Second Edition Eternal Council Faction

boardgame.name: Spies: Harry Houdini
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Website

YOU are a famous magician. You are known for your death-defying stunts and extraordinary escape acts. One day you are approached by a mysterious man with a serious request: with all of your sleight of hand and intelligence, will you become a spy to learn information abroad and help the United States?

boardgame.name: Spies: Mata Hari
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Website

YOU are young Margaretha Zelle, a world-famous dancer from the Netherlands. You have just arrived in Bali with your dance troupe when your best friend Althea goes missing. As a master of tongues and disguises, who better to save her? But if you leave now, you will miss your chance to audition for the performance of a lifetime.

boardgame.name: Blazing Skates
boardgame.description:
Blazing Skates is a sport game that recreates short track races of winter Olympic sport.
The game is played along a printed rink divided in sectors and boxes.
From 2 to 5 skaters can skate in a single race.
2d6 dice are used to move skaters and tables help to resolve any aspect of game.
Each skater is represented by individual cards
A set of Ladies and Men skaters are published: available sets World Championship Dordrecht 2021 and Olympic Games Beijng 2022 500m race.

It's a free print and play game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pirates Dragons Treasure
boardgame.description:
When you play Pirates Dragons Treasure, you take on the role of a Pirate Captain. Pirates like you have sailed these seas for generations -- plundering their waters, creating treasure hoards that rival the riches of kings. Indeed, times have been good for you swashbucklers, but times are about to change. Where you find gold, sure you'll find pirates, but you'll also find... DRAGONS! The scourge of the land, sea, and sky have invaded your world and aim to steal your treasure! Can you outwit your rivals and build a crew strong enough to defeat the dragons?

In Pirates Dragons Treasure players take turns building their drawing cards and using treasure to purchase crews and ship upgrades. Once ready, players challenge the dragon that torments the group, and the player who defeats the beast first wins the game.

The game provides a rich world of characters, upgrades, curses, and dragons, through beautifully illustrated artwork, easy-to-learn mechanics, and ample opportunity for group engagement and trickery. The game is created for novice to seasoned games and creates exciting engagements for players time and time again.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Weavlings in the Wilds
boardgame.description:
Weavlings in the Wilds is a fantasy grid-based solo game where you must capture the fauna of the Tender Wilds with trap cards and lure Weavlings back home with the promise of succulent meat. Collect 10 lured population to win the game. Receive 10 wounds, run out of traps, or lose 10 population, and the game ends.

This game can be played in a beginner, normal, and hard mode that adds additional challenges.

Similar to:
Sylvion- Weavlings in the Wilds randomizes the grid with one deck instead of using one deck per row.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Deck of Casual Characters: Priests
boardgame.description:
The Decks of Casual Characters is a collection of decks of the various types of characters one might discover in their world. Each deck contains individuals of similar background or story elements and will add some excitement to your tabletop games with endless categories and characters. When your players start interacting with the people of the world at random, you will always be prepared with each deck containing 50 categorized NPCs, filled with their story, personalities, and more!

With this deck of cards GM’s and Players alike can:


Give their adventures and characters a variety of people they can interact with in temples & churches.
Always have a supply of people with details more than a random name thought of quickly.
Bring the elements of divinity and zealous followers into your world with a ready supply of characters.
Make the keeping of individuals met by a party by simply organizing cards.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Deck of Dangerous Devices: Explosives
boardgame.description:
The decks of Dangerous Devices are a collection of decks filled with a variety of explosive and dangerous devices. In this collection, you will find 200+ different explosives, mixtures, mutagens, and trapped explosives, for your game of the 5th Edition of the world's most well-known tabletop role-playing game. Each deck consists of 50+ beautifully illustrated cards, tailor-made for those who wish to make a bang or that adventures might come across in your world.

Deck of Dangerous Devices – Explosives – 54 Card Deck

With this deck of cards GM’s and Players alike can:


Give their adventures and characters a variety of different explosives to use in their adventures.



Make the tracking and use of the explosive easy, by simply taking and receiving the card.



Bring the elements of science and technology into your world but also discover their magical ties.



Make the keeping of notes and items easily achievable with ready-to-go item cards.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Nazekayomechau
ナゼカヨメチャウ (Why can you read this?)
boardgame.description:
ナゼカヨメチャウ (Nazekayomechau) (Why can you read this?) is a party/action game from Japan. The idea came to the designer whilst editing rules for games and looking for typos. It is based on the internet meme Typoglycemia.

In the game, players take turns asking the question. They read the answers to two texts and then show the texts to the other players. But certain parts of the text are blocked by round images, so the players must work out what is really being said. When they have solved two sections, they must perform the action being instructed. The player with the answer declares the first and second winners to perform the action required, who get points.

The first player to reach six points wins the game.

The illustrated texts show examples such as round ladybirds, fairy lights, koi, lanterns, a baseball, and an owl on the branch (the publisher being an owl).
user summary

This is a new, easy party game that combines "quiz" and "action".
Players are divided into contestants and respondents.
The contestant chooses one question from the list of questions and checks the answer. Afterwards, the answers are published for the respondents to see. Respondents look at the published hole in the text and try to guess what it says.
As soon as they have an idea of what it says, they move on to the next question. As soon as they know what it says, they take action.
If one of the respondent's actions matches the answer, the contestant points out, "Correct!" The first correct answer is unconditional.
The first correct answer gets one point unconditionally, and the second correct answer gets one point if it matches the answer to what they read in the text. The game is repeated in the same way, switching contestants.
The game ends when one of the players scores 6 points.

「クイズ」+「アクション」 の新感覚お手軽パーティーゲームです。
プレイヤーは出題者と回答者に分かれます。
出題者は問題リストから1問選び、解答を確認します。その後、回答者が見えるよう公開します。回答者は公開された穴空きの文章を見て、なんと書いてあるのかを予想します。
こうかな？っと内容が分かったらすぐに行動に移します。
回答者のいずれかの行動内容と答えが合っていたら、出題者は「正解！」と指摘します。
1人目の正解者は無条件で1点、2人目の正解者は文章をなんと読んだのかを答え、解答と一致していれば1点獲得です。出題者を交代し、同じように繰り返します。
いずれかのプレイヤーが6点獲得したらゲーム終了です。
publisher's summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Deck of Beneficial Boons
boardgame.description:
This deck contains 50+ magical beneficial effects from the heavens or hells depending on your story! Did your players upset a mighty devil or irritate a powerful deity! Then this deck is for you! The boons of this deck are made for the 5th edition of the world’s most popular role-playing game but can easily be adapted into other rulesets as needed.

The Deck of Beneficial Boons – 54 Card Deck

With this deck of cards GM’s and Players alike can:


Provide a reward from a powerful entity other than treasure, an item, or title.
Fill their world with possible boons for a variety of reasons with 200 possible boons.
Allow the randomness of boons to be at the player's hand by the rolling of a die.
Connect the boons to deities, temples, and priests of their worlds.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Deck of Bewitched Brews
boardgame.description:
50+ magical consumables per deck in the shape of natural, potions, poisons, and cooked consumables for 5th edition. These decks are filled with unique magic consumables specifically tuned for the magical edibles in the 5th Edition of the world's most well-known tabletop role-playing game! Each deck consists of 50+ beautifully illustrated cards, tailor-made for wild flora that may occur in your world. Every card has custom art on the front depicting a fully customized magic item and a full description of the consumable on the back. We've built this series of decks for dungeon masters and players alike! Dungeon Masters will be able to expedite the rewarding process and quickly introduce these items into your campaign either through advance planning or simply pulling a card at random! It's that easy! Players will save time and simply refer to the card instead of writing half a page of text on their character sheet!

- from the publisher's blurb
